explanation: All paths, when understood deeply, converge to the same truth. Focus on aligning your actions and thoughts with your goal rather than on the method alone.

sanskrit: संन्यासस्तु महाबाहो दुःखमाप्तुमयोगतः। योगयुक्तो मुनिर्ब्रह्म नचिरेणाधिगच्छति॥
translation: Renunciation is difficult to attain without yoga. A sage who is disciplined in yoga quickly attains Brahman.
explanation: Discipline and self-mastery are essential for progress. Engage actively in self-improvement to achieve higher goals.

sanskrit: योगयुक्तो विशुद्धात्मा विजितात्मा जितेन्द्रियः। सर्वभूतात्मभूतात्मा कुर्वन्नपि न लिप्यते॥
translation: One who is disciplined in yoga, pure in mind, self-controlled, and master of the senses, even while acting, is not affected by karma.
explanation: Purify your intentions and maintain control over your senses. This allows you to engage in actions without being entangled by their consequences.

sanskrit: नैव किंचित्करोमीति युक्तो मन्येत तत्त्ववित्। पश्यन्शृण्वन्स्पृशञ्जिघ्रन्नश्नन्गच्छन्स्वपन्श्वसन्॥
translation: One who is united in yoga and knows the truth thinks, 'I do nothing at all,' even while seeing, hearing, touching, smelling, eating, moving, sleeping, or breathing.
explanation: Recognize yourself as the observer rather than the doer. This perspective fosters peace and prevents overattachment to outcomes.

sanskrit: प्रलपन्विसृजन्गृह्णन्नुन्मिषन्निमिषन्नपि। इन्द्रियाणीन्द्रियार्थेषु वर्तन्त इति धारयन्॥
translation: While talking, giving, taking, opening, or closing his eyes, he understands that the senses engage with their objects.
explanation: Understand that life is a flow of interactions between senses and objects. This awareness helps maintain inner stability amidst external activity.

sanskrit: ब्रह्मण्याधाय कर्माणि सङ्गं त्यक्त्वा करोति यः। लिप्यते न स पापेन पद्मपत्रमिवाम्भसा॥
translation: One who performs actions, renouncing attachment and dedicating them to Brahman, is untouched by sin, just as a lotus leaf remains untouched by water.
explanation: Dedicate your actions to a higher purpose and renounce attachment to outcomes. This leads to freedom and purity in life.

sanskrit: कायेन मनसा बुद्ध्या केवलैरिन्द्रियैरपि। योगिनः कर्म कुर्वन्ति सङ्गं त्यक्त्वात्मशुद्धये॥
translation: The yogis perform actions merely with the body, mind, intellect, and senses, renouncing attachment, for the purification of the self.
explanation: For individuals seeking personal growth and inner purity, this verse advises performing duties selflessly without attachment. Focus on actions as a means of self-purification, not for personal gain or recognition.

sanskrit: युक्तः कर्मफलं त्यक्त्वा शान्तिमाप्नोति नैष्ठिकीम्। अयुक्तः कामकारेण फले सक्तो निबध्यते॥
translation: The one who is disciplined, renouncing the fruits of actions, attains everlasting peace. The undisciplined, driven by desires and attached to results, becomes bound.
explanation: For achieving peace of mind, detach from the outcomes of your actions. Engage in disciplined effort without worrying about results. Avoid being swayed by desires to free yourself from stress.

sanskrit: सर्वकर्माणि मनसा संन्यस्यास्ते सुखं वशी। नवद्वारे पुरे देही नैव कुर्वन्न कारयन्॥
translation: Renouncing all actions mentally, the self-controlled one dwells happily in the city of nine gates, neither acting nor causing others to act.
explanation: For those feeling overwhelmed, learn to mentally detach from tasks and responsibilities while performing them. Cultivate self-control and live peacefully within your body and mind (the 'city of nine gates').

sanskrit: न कर्तृत्वं न कर्माणि लोकस्य सृजति प्रभुः। न कर्मफलसंयोगं स्वभावस्तु प्रवर्तते॥
translation: The Supreme does not create actions, agency, or the connection between actions and results; it is nature that functions.
explanation: For those struggling with blame or guilt, understand that actions and their outcomes are driven by natural laws, not imposed by external forces. Focus on doing your best without overburdening yourself with outcomes.

sanskrit: नादत्ते कस्यचित्पापं न चैव सुकृतं विभुः। अज्ञानेनावृतं ज्ञानं तेन मुह्यन्ति जन्तवः॥
translation: The all-pervading one neither accepts the sins nor virtues of anyone. Knowledge is obscured by ignorance, and thus beings are deluded.
explanation: If you're feeling confused or misled, this verse highlights that ignorance clouds true understanding. Seek knowledge to dispel delusion and make clear, informed choices.

sanskrit: ज्ञानेन तु तदज्ञानं येषां नाशितमात्मनः। तेषामादित्यवज्ज्ञानं प्रकाशयति तत्परम्॥
translation: For those whose ignorance is destroyed by knowledge, their wisdom, like the sun, illuminates the supreme.
explanation: To overcome confusion, cultivate wisdom through learning and introspection. Enlightenment will naturally reveal clarity and purpose in your life.

sanskrit: तद्बुद्धयस्तदात्मानस्तन्निष्ठास्तत्परायणाः। गच्छन्त्यपुनरावृत्तिं ज्ञाननिर्धूतकल्मषाः॥
translation: Those whose intellect, self, faith, and refuge are in That (Supreme) are cleansed of impurities by knowledge and attain liberation.
explanation: For those seeking liberation from negativity, align your thoughts, actions, and faith with a higher purpose. Pure intent leads to freedom from mental impurities.

sanskrit: विद्याविनयसम्पन्ने ब्राह्मणे गवि हस्तिनि। शुनि चैव श्वपाके च पण्डिताः समदर्शिनः॥
translation: The wise see with equal vision a learned and humble Brahmin, a cow, an elephant, a dog, and a dog-eater.
explanation: To develop harmony and equality, cultivate a mindset that sees the inherent value in all beings. Embrace humility and equal respect for everyone, irrespective of status or appearance.

sanskrit: इहैव तैर्जितः सर्गो येषां साम्ये स्थितं मनः। निर्दोषं हि समं ब्रह्म तस्माद्ब्रह्मणि ते स्थिताः॥
translation: Even here, those whose minds are established in equanimity have overcome creation. Being without faults, they are established in Brahman.
explanation: For overcoming life's dualities, maintain mental balance and equanimity. Equanimity leads to inner freedom and realization of higher truths.

sanskrit: न प्रहृष्येत्प्रियं प्राप्य नोद्विजेत्प्राप्य चाप्रियम्। स्थिरबुद्धिरसम्मूढो ब्रह्मविद् ब्रह्मणि स्थितः॥
translation: One should neither rejoice upon obtaining the pleasant nor lament upon encountering the unpleasant. The wise, unbewildered, and steady in intellect, know Brahman and are established in It.
explanation: For emotional stability, train yourself not to overreact to positive or negative events. Cultivate steadiness of mind, as this leads to wisdom and peace.

sanskrit: बाह्यस्पर्शेष्वसक्तात्मा विन्दत्यात्मनि यत्सुखम्। स ब्रह्मयोगयुक्तात्मा सुखमक्षयमश्नुते॥
translation: One who is unattached to external sense pleasures finds happiness in the Self. Such a person, united with Brahman, attains everlasting joy.
explanation: For those seeking lasting happiness, focus inward rather than relying on external pleasures. True joy is found in self-realization, not fleeting sensory experiences.

sanskrit: ये हि संस्पर्शजा भोगा दुःखयोनय एव ते। आद्यन्तवन्तः कौन्तेय न तेषु रमते बुधः॥
translation: The pleasures that arise from contact with the senses are sources of misery; they have a beginning and an end. Therefore, the wise do not delight in them.
explanation: If you are struggling with dissatisfaction, understand that sensory pleasures are temporary and lead to discomfort. Seek contentment in pursuits beyond material indulgence.

sanskrit: शक्नोतीहैव यः सोढुं प्राक्शरीरविमोक्षणात्। कामक्रोधोद्भवं वेगं स युक्तः स सुखी नरः॥
translation: One who can withstand the impulses of desire and anger before leaving the body is truly disciplined and happy.
explanation: To manage impulsive emotions, cultivate self-control and resilience. Controlling desires and anger brings lasting peace and discipline.

sanskrit: योऽन्तःसुखोऽन्तरारामस्तथान्तर्ज्योतिरेव यः। स योगी ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं ब्रह्मभूतोऽधिगच्छति॥
translation: One who finds joy within, is inwardly focused, and whose inner light shines, such a yogi attains liberation in Brahman.
explanation: To achieve inner peace and fulfillment, turn your attention inward. Joy and enlightenment come from internal awareness and self-reflection.

sanskrit: लभन्ते ब्रह्मनिर्वाणमृषयः क्षीणकल्मषाः। छिन्नद्वैधा यतात्मानः सर्वभूतहिते रताः॥
translation: The sages, whose sins are destroyed, who are free from doubt, self-disciplined, and delight in the welfare of all beings, attain liberation in Brahman.
explanation: For spiritual growth, practice self-discipline, clarity of purpose, and kindness toward others. These qualities lead to liberation and peace.

sanskrit: कामक्रोधवियुक्तानां यतीनां यतचेतसाम्। अभितो ब्रह्मनिर्वाणं वर्तते विदितात्मनाम्॥
translation: For those free from desire and anger, self-restrained, and self-aware, liberation in Brahman is near.
explanation: To free yourself from mental turmoil, work on letting go of desires and anger while developing self-awareness and restraint.

sanskrit: स्पर्शान्कृत्वा बहिर्बाह्यांश्चक्षुश्चैवान्तरे भ्रुवोः। प्राणापानौ समौ कृत्वा नासाभ्यन्तरचारिणौ॥
translation: Keeping external contacts outside, fixing the gaze between the eyebrows, and balancing the inhalation and exhalation, the yogi attains control.
explanation: For achieving focus and calm, practice meditation by withdrawing your senses and balancing your breath. This steadies the mind and promotes clarity.

sanskrit: यतेन्द्रियमनोबुद्धिर्मुनिर्मोक्षपरायणः। विगतेच्छाभयक्रोधो यः सदा मुक्त एव सः॥
translation: One who controls the senses, mind, and intellect, is dedicated to liberation, and is free from desire, fear, and anger, is always liberated.
explanation: For freedom from inner conflict, practice controlling your mind and emotions. Let go of desires and fears to live in a state of liberation.

sanskrit: भोक्तारं यज्ञतपसां सर्वलोकमहेश्वरम्। सुहृदं सर्वभूतानां ज्ञात्वा मां शान्तिमृच्छति॥
translation: Knowing Me as the enjoyer of sacrifices and austerities, the great Lord of all worlds, and the friend of all beings, one attains peace.
explanation: To find peace, recognize the divine as the ultimate benefactor and friend of all. Cultivate a sense of surrender and trust in the higher power.

sanskrit: अनाश्रितः कर्मफलं कार्यं कर्म करोति यः। स संन्यासी च योगी च न निरग्निर्न चाक्रियः॥
translation: One who performs their duties without attachment to the fruits of actions is a true renunciate and yogi, not one who merely renounces fire or action.
explanation: To balance work and spiritual growth, focus on performing your duties sincerely without clinging to outcomes. True renunciation is about detachment, not inactivity.

sanskrit: यं संन्यासमिति प्राहुर्योगं तं विद्धि पाण्डव। न ह्यसंन्यस्तसंकल्पो योगी भवति कश्चन॥
translation: What is called renunciation is also yoga. For no one becomes a yogi without renouncing selfish desires.
explanation: If you're struggling with inner peace, start by letting go of selfish desires. Renunciation of these helps you align with a balanced and harmonious life.

sanskrit: आरुरुक्षोर्मुनेर्योगं कर्म कारणमुच्यते। योगारूढस्य तस्यैव शमः कारणमुच्यते॥
translation: For the aspiring yogi, action is the means; for the one established in yoga, tranquility becomes the means.
explanation: For personal growth, initially focus on disciplined action to build a foundation. Once steady, cultivate inner calm to deepen your spiritual progress.

sanskrit: यदा हि न इन्द्रियार्थेषु न कर्मस्वनुषज्जते। सर्वसंकल्पसंन्यासी योगारूढस्तदोच्यते॥
translation: When one is no longer attached to sense objects or actions, having renounced all desires, they are said to be firmly established in yoga.
explanation: To overcome attachments, focus on mindfulness and detachment from material desires. This leads to inner stability and spiritual progress.

sanskrit: उद्धरेदात्मनात्मानं नात्मानमवसादयेत्। आत्मैव ह्यात्मनो बन्धुरात्मैव रिपुरात्मनः॥
translation: One should elevate oneself by one’s own mind, not degrade oneself. The self is both the friend and the enemy of the self.
explanation: If feeling self-critical, remember that you have the power to uplift or hinder yourself. Cultivate positive self-talk and self-discipline to become your own best ally.

sanskrit: बन्धुरात्मात्मनस्तस्य येनात्मैवात्मना जितः। अनात्मनस्तु शत्रुत्वे वर्तेतात्मैव शत्रुवत्॥
translation: For one who has conquered the self, the self is the friend. But for one who has not, the self acts as an enemy.
explanation: To overcome internal struggles, master your mind through discipline and introspection. Self-mastery turns your inner nature into a supportive friend.

sanskrit: जितात्मनः प्रशान्तस्य परमात्मा समाहितः। शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु तथा मानापमानयोः॥
translation: The Supreme is established in one who is self-controlled, peaceful, and remains undisturbed by heat and cold, pleasure and pain, or honor and dishonor.
explanation: To find peace in life, cultivate equanimity in the face of life's ups and downs. Self-control helps you stay centered regardless of external circumstances.

sanskrit: ज्ञानविज्ञानतृप्तात्मा कूटस्थो विजितेन्द्रियः। युक्त इत्युच्यते योगी समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः॥
translation: One who is satisfied with knowledge and wisdom, unshakable, and has mastered the senses, sees a lump of earth, stone, and gold as equal, and is said to be established in yoga.
explanation: For a stable and unbiased mind, value knowledge over material possessions. Mastering the senses leads to impartiality and contentment.

sanskrit: सुहृन्मित्रार्युदासीनमध्यस्थद्वेष्यबन्धुषु। साधुष्वपि च पापेषु समबुद्धिर्विशिष्यते॥
translation: One who maintains equal vision toward friends, enemies, the indifferent, the neutral, the hateful, relatives, the virtuous, and the sinful excels in yoga.
explanation: To maintain harmony in relationships, develop equal regard for all, irrespective of their actions. This attitude fosters inner peace and detachment.

sanskrit: योगी युञ्जीत सततमत्मानं रहसि स्थितः। एकाकी यतचित्तात्मा निराशीः अपरिग्रहः॥
translation: The yogi should constantly engage the mind in meditation, remaining in solitude, self-controlled, free from desires, and without possessions.
explanation: For deep focus and clarity, spend time in solitude, detach from material cravings, and practice mindfulness. Simplicity fosters spiritual progress.

sanskrit: शुचौ देशे प्रतिष्ठाप्य स्थिरमासनमात्मनः। नात्युच्छ्रितं नातिनीचं चैलाजिनकुशोत्तरम्॥
translation: In a clean and sacred place, establish a firm seat for oneself, neither too high nor too low, covered with cloth, deer skin, and kusha grass.
explanation: For effective meditation, choose a clean, stable, and comfortable spot that fosters concentration and detachment from distractions.

sanskrit: तत्रैकाग्रं मनः कृत्वा यतचित्तेन्द्रियक्रियः। उपविश्यासने युञ्ज्याद्योगमात्मविशुद्धये॥
translation: Seated there, focusing the mind and controlling the senses and actions, engage in yoga for the purification of the self.
explanation: To purify your mind and body, practice meditation with focus and discipline, ensuring control over your senses and thoughts.

sanskrit: समं कायशिरोग्रीवं धारयन्नचलं स्थिरः। संप्रेक्ष्य नासिकाग्रं स्वं दिशश्चानवलोकयन्॥
translation: Keep the body, head, and neck straight and steady, gaze fixed on the tip of the nose, and avoid looking around.
explanation: For concentration during meditation, maintain a stable posture and direct your attention inward, avoiding external distractions.

sanskrit: प्रशान्तात्मा विगतभीर्ब्रह्मचारिव्रते स्थितः। मनः संयम्य मच्चित्तो युक्त आसीत मत्परः॥
translation: With a peaceful mind, free from fear, established in the vow of celibacy, having controlled the mind, the yogi should meditate on Me, focused and devoted.
explanation: To achieve spiritual growth, cultivate inner peace, eliminate fears, and focus your devotion on higher consciousness or the divine.

sanskrit: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी नियतमानसः। शान्तिं निर्वाणपरमां मत्संस्थामधिगच्छति॥
translation: By meditating in this way, with a disciplined mind, the yogi attains supreme peace and liberation that abides in Me.
explanation: To find ultimate peace, practice meditation consistently with a disciplined and devoted mind, connecting with higher consciousness.

sanskrit: नात्यश्नतस्तु योगोऽस्ति न चैकान्तमनश्नतः। न चातिस्वप्नशीलस्य जाग्रतो नैव चार्जुन॥
translation: Yoga is not for one who eats excessively or does not eat at all, nor for one who sleeps excessively or remains awake too long.
explanation: Maintain moderation in eating, sleeping, and waking habits to achieve physical and mental balance for effective yoga practice.

sanskrit: युक्ताहारविहारस्य युक्तचेष्टस्य कर्मसु। युक्तस्वप्नावबोधस्य योगो भवति दुःखहा॥
translation: For one who is moderate in eating, recreation, work, sleep, and wakefulness, yoga becomes a destroyer of suffering.
explanation: To alleviate stress and suffering, adopt a balanced lifestyle that incorporates moderation in all aspects of daily life.

sanskrit: यदा विनियतं चित्तमात्मन्येवावतिष्ठते। निःस्पृहः सर्वकामेभ्यो युक्त इत्युच्यते तदा॥
translation: When the disciplined mind rests in the self, free from all desires, then one is said to be firmly established in yoga.
explanation: Achieve self-discipline and detachment from desires to cultivate a focused and content state of being.

sanskrit: यथा दीपो निवातस्थो नेङ्गते सोपमा स्मृता। योगिनो यतचित्तस्य युञ्जतो योगमात्मनः॥
translation: Just as a lamp in a windless place does not flicker, so is the comparison for the yogi with a focused and controlled mind in meditation.
explanation: To attain a stable mind, practice unwavering focus during meditation, just as a steady flame remains undisturbed by external influences.

sanskrit: यत्रोपरमते चित्तं निरुद्धं योगसेवया। यत्र चैवात्मनात्मानं पश्यन्नात्मनि तुष्यति॥
translation: When the mind becomes still through yoga practice, and one sees the self within, one experiences contentment in the self.
explanation: Through dedicated yoga practice, calm the mind and discover inner joy by realizing your true self.

sanskrit: सुखमात्यन्तिकं यत्तद्बुद्धिग्राह्यमतीन्द्रियम्। वेत्ति यत्र न चैवायं स्थितश्चलति तत्त्वतः॥
translation: That ultimate bliss which is perceived by the intellect and transcends the senses, and wherein established, one does not waver from the truth.
explanation: To experience lasting inner joy, focus on intellectual and spiritual realization beyond sensory pleasures. This unwavering state provides true contentment.

sanskrit: यं लब्ध्वा चापरं लाभं मन्यते नाधिकं ततः। यस्मिन्स्थितो न दुःखेन गुरुणापि विचाल्यते॥
translation: Having attained this, one does not consider any other gain superior, and being established in this, one is not shaken even by the greatest sorrow.
explanation: Achieve a state of fulfillment where external losses or gains no longer disturb you. Inner stability is the highest gain.

sanskrit: तं विद्याद्दुःखसंयोगवियोगं योगसंज्ञितम्। स निश्चयेन योक्तव्यो योगोऽनिर्विण्णचेतसा॥
translation: Know that state to be called yoga, which is disconnection from the union with sorrow. It should be practiced with determination and a focused mind.
explanation: Detach from sources of sorrow and align your mind with disciplined efforts to cultivate mental clarity and contentment.

sanskrit: सङ्कल्पप्रभवान्कामान्स्त्यक्त्वा सर्वानशेषतः। मनसैवेन्द्रियग्रामं विनियम्य समन्ततः॥
translation: Completely renouncing all desires born of mental intentions and restraining the senses from all sides with the mind.
explanation: To overcome distractions and desires, exercise control over the senses and focus the mind on inner goals.

sanskrit: शनैः शनैरुपरमेद्बुद्ध्या धृतिगृहीतया। आत्मसंस्थं मनः कृत्वा न किञ्चिदपि चिन्तयेत्॥
translation: Gradually, step by step, attain tranquility with a firm and steady intellect, fixing the mind on the self and thinking of nothing else.
explanation: Achieve mental stillness by practicing gradual self-discipline and focusing solely on your inner self.

sanskrit: यतो यतो निश्चरति मनश्चञ्चलमस्थिरम्। ततस्ततो नियम्यैतदात्मन्येव वशं नयेत्॥
translation: From wherever the restless and unsteady mind wanders, bring it back and control it within the self.
explanation: When the mind becomes distracted, gently redirect it to focus inward, cultivating mindfulness and self-awareness.

sanskrit: प्रशान्तमनसं ह्येनं योगिनं सुखमुत्तमम्। उपैति शान्तरजसं ब्रह्मभूतमकल्मषम्॥
translation: The yogi whose mind is tranquil, whose passions are calmed, and who is sinless, attains supreme bliss and becomes one with Brahman.
explanation: Calm your passions and clear your mind of negativity to experience profound joy and unity with the universal consciousness.

sanskrit: युञ्जन्नेवं सदात्मानं योगी विगतकल्मषः। सुखेन ब्रह्मसंस्पर्शमत्यन्तं सुखमश्नुते॥
translation: The yogi who practices in this way, freed from impurities, easily attains supreme bliss through union with Brahman.
explanation: Consistent meditation purifies the mind and enables connection with the ultimate reality, bringing unparalleled happiness.

sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थमात्मानं सर्वभूतानि चात्मनि। ईक्षते योगयुक्तात्मा सर्वत्र समदर्शनः॥
translation: The yogi, with a harmonized mind, sees the self in all beings and all beings in the self, seeing the same everywhere.
explanation: Cultivate universal compassion by recognizing the interconnectedness of all beings and embracing equality.

sanskrit: यो मां पश्यति सर्वत्र सर्वं च मयि पश्यति। तस्याहं न प्रणश्यामि स च मे न प्रणश्यति॥
translation: One who sees Me everywhere and sees everything in Me, for such a person I am never lost, and they are never lost to Me.
explanation: Foster a sense of unity with the divine by seeing divinity in all and maintaining a constant connection with the divine presence.

sanskrit: सर्वभूतस्थितं यो मां भजत्येकत्वमास्थितः। सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि स योगी मयि वर्तते॥
translation: He who worships Me as residing in all beings, established in oneness, remains in Me, the yogi, regardless of his manner of living.
explanation: To cultivate unity and harmony, recognize the divine presence in all beings and embrace oneness in thought and action.

sanskrit: आत्मौपम्येन सर्वत्र समं पश्यति योऽर्जुन। सुखं वा यदि वा दुःखं स योगी परमो मतः॥
translation: One who, by comparison with himself, sees the same everywhere, whether in happiness or in distress, that yogi is considered supreme.
explanation: Develop empathy and treat others' joys and sorrows as your own, fostering a deeper sense of connection and understanding.

sanskrit: यायं योगस्त्वया प्रोक्तः साम्येन मधुसूदन। एतस्याहं न पश्यामि चञ्चलत्वात्स्थितिं स्थिराम्॥
translation: Arjuna said: O Madhusudana, this yoga of equanimity you have described—I do not see its steady application due to the restlessness of the mind.
explanation: When faced with challenges in practicing equanimity, acknowledge the difficulty and seek guidance to strengthen your resolve.

sanskrit: चञ्चलं हि मनः कृष्ण प्रमाथि बलवद्दृढम्। तस्याहं निग्रहं मन्ये वायोरिव सुदुष्करम्॥
translation: The mind is indeed restless, turbulent, powerful, and obstinate, O Krishna. I think it is as difficult to control as the wind.
explanation: Accept the inherent restlessness of the mind, but with perseverance and discipline, aim to bring it under control.

sanskrit: असंशयं महाबाहो मनो दुर्निग्रहं चलम्। अभ्यासेन तु कौन्तेय वैराग्येण च गृह्यते॥
translation: Undoubtedly, O mighty-armed one, the mind is difficult to control and restless, but it can be restrained through practice and detachment.
explanation: Overcome mental distractions with consistent practice and by letting go of attachments that cause restlessness.

sanskrit: असंयतात्मना योगो दुष्प्राप इति मे मतिः। वश्यात्मना तु यतता शक्योऽवाप्तुमुपायतः॥
translation: Yoga is difficult to attain for one whose mind is not disciplined, but it is possible for one who strives with a controlled mind.
explanation: Success in self-realization requires persistent effort and self-control. Cultivate discipline to achieve your goals.

sanskrit: अयतिः श्रद्धयोपेतो योगाच्चलितमानसः। अप्राप्य योगसंसिद्धिं कां गतिं कृष्ण गच्छति॥
translation: Arjuna said: O Krishna, what happens to one who has faith but is unable to control his mind and fails to attain perfection in yoga?
explanation: When progress seems uncertain, have faith and understand that partial effort is never wasted; seek guidance to continue.

sanskrit: कच्चिन्नोभयविभ्रष्टश्छिन्नाभ्रमिव नश्यति। अप्रतिष्ठो महाबाहो विमूढो ब्रह्मणः पथि॥
translation: Does one who is unsuccessful in both spiritual and worldly paths perish like a broken cloud, unsupported and deluded on the path of Brahman?
explanation: Fear of failure is natural, but trust that no effort on the spiritual path is ever in vain.

sanskrit: एतन्मे संशयं कृष्ण छेत्तुमर्हस्यशेषतः। त्वदन्यः संशयस्यास्य छेत्ता न ह्युपपद्यते॥
translation: O Krishna, please dispel this doubt of mine completely, for none other than you can remove it.
explanation: Seek clarity and answers from trusted sources when doubts arise, and rely on experienced guidance for resolution.

sanskrit: पार्थ नैवेह नामुत्र विनाशस्तस्य विद्यते। न हि कल्याणकृत्कश्चिद्दुर्गतिं तात गच्छति॥
translation: O Partha, there is no destruction for him, either in this world or the next. One who does good, dear friend, never comes to grief.
explanation: Every positive effort bears fruit, even if the full result is not immediately visible. Trust in the enduring value of virtuous actions.

sanskrit: प्राप्य पुण्यकृतां लोकानुषित्वा शाश्वतीः समाः। शुचीनां श्रीमतां गेहे योगभ्रष्टोऽभिजायते॥
translation: Having attained the worlds of the righteous and lived there for many years, one who falls from yoga is born into a family of the pure and prosperous.
explanation: Even partial efforts in spiritual practice bring blessings, and setbacks are only temporary. Trust that every step forward creates a better foundation for future progress.

sanskrit: अथवा योगिनामेव कुले भवति धीमताम्। एतद्धि दुर्लभतरं लोके जन्म यदीदृशम्॥
translation: Or he is born into a family of wise yogis. Such a birth is rare to obtain in this world.
explanation: Efforts on the spiritual path lead to favorable circumstances, even if results are not immediate. Stay steadfast, as each step contributes to future growth.

sanskrit: तत्र तं बुद्धिसंयोगं लभते पौर्वदेहिकम्। यतते च ततो भूयः संसिद्धौ कुरुनन्दन॥
translation: There, he regains the spiritual intellect of his previous birth and strives further toward perfection, O descendant of the Kurus.
explanation: Past efforts are never wasted; they become stepping stones for future progress. Trust in the cumulative power of perseverance.

sanskrit: पूर्वाभ्यासेन तेनैव ह्रियते ह्यवशोऽपि सः। जिज्ञासुरपि योगस्य शब्दब्रह्मातिवर्तते॥
translation: By virtue of the previous practice, he is carried forward even unwillingly. Even a seeker of yoga transcends the Vedic rites.
explanation: Habits formed through sincere effort will naturally guide you forward, even during periods of doubt. Maintain faith in your innate progress.

sanskrit: प्रयत्नाद्यतमानस्तु योगी संशुद्धकिल्बिषः। अनेकजन्मसंसिद्धस्ततो याति परां गतिम्॥
translation: With effort and determination, the yogi, purified of sins, perfects himself through many births and attains the supreme goal.
explanation: Every sincere effort, regardless of the timeline, brings you closer to ultimate fulfillment. Persist with patience and determination.

sanskrit: तपस्विभ्योऽधिको योगी ज्ञानीभ्योऽपि मतोऽधिकः। कर्मिभ्यश्चाधिको योगी तस्माद्योगी भवार्जुन॥
translation: The yogi is superior to the ascetic, superior to the learned, and superior to the ritualist. Therefore, O Arjuna, be a yogi.
explanation: Among all practices, dedicating yourself to disciplined self-realization is the highest path. Prioritize mindfulness and inner growth.

sanskrit: योगिनामपि सर्वेषां मद्गतेनान्तरात्मना। श्रद्धावान्भजते यो मां स मे युक्ततमो मतः॥
translation: Among all yogis, the one who worships Me with faith, his inner self absorbed in Me, is the most united with Me in yoga.
explanation: The highest connection is achieved through faith and devotion. Cultivate a sincere relationship with the divine to find ultimate unity and peace.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। मय्यासक्तमना: पार्थ योगं युञ्जन्मदाश्रय:। असंशयं समग्रं मां यथा ज्ञास्यसि तच्छृणु॥
translation: The Blessed Lord said: With your mind attached to Me, practicing yoga under My shelter, listen, O Partha, as I explain how you shall know Me completely, without doubt.
explanation: To understand the ultimate truth, align your mind with a higher purpose and seek guidance. A focused approach, free of distractions, ensures comprehensive understanding.

sanskrit: ज्ञानं तेऽहं सविज्ञानमिदं वक्ष्याम्यशेषत:। यज्ज्ञात्वा नेह भूयोऽन्यज्ज्ञातव्यमवशिष्यते॥
translation: I shall impart to you this knowledge and wisdom in full, knowing which, nothing else will remain to be known.
explanation: Seek holistic knowledge that integrates theory and practice. When you master this, confusion about life’s purpose diminishes.

sanskrit: मनुष्याणां सहस्रेषु कश्चिद्यतति सिद्धये। यततामपि सिद्धानां कश्चिन्मां वेत्ति तत्त्वत:॥
translation: Among thousands of men, one strives for perfection; and among those who strive, only a few truly know Me in essence.
explanation: True understanding requires perseverance and rarity doesn’t imply impossibility. Be among the few who strive for deeper truths.

sanskrit: भूमिरापोऽनलो वायु: खं मनो बुद्धिरेव च। अहंकार इतीयं मे भिन्ना प्रकृतिरष्टधा॥
translation: Earth, water, fire, air, ether, mind, intellect, and ego—these constitute My eightfold differentiated material energy.
explanation: Understand the building blocks of existence. Recognizing these helps you manage life’s complexities with awareness.

sanskrit: अपरेयमितस्त्वन्यां प्रकृतिं विद्धि मे पराम्। जीवभूतां महाबाहो ययेदं धार्यते जगत्॥
translation: Beyond this, know My higher energy, the living beings, which sustains the universe, O mighty-armed one.
explanation: Acknowledge the power of life itself. By appreciating this higher force, you can align with your deeper purpose.

sanskrit: एतद्योनिनी भूतानि सर्वाणीत्युपधारय। अहं कृत्स्नस्य जगत: प्रभव: प्रलयस्तथा॥
translation: Know that all beings emanate from these two energies. I am the origin and dissolution of the entire universe.
explanation: Understand the interconnectedness of creation and its cyclical nature. Knowing the source helps in gaining clarity and peace.

sanskrit: मत्त: परतरं नान्यत्किंचिदस्ति धनञ्जय। मयि सर्वमिदं प्रोतं सूत्रे मणिगणा इव॥
translation: O Dhananjaya, there is nothing superior to Me. Everything rests upon Me like pearls strung on a thread.
explanation: Recognize the centrality of the divine in all aspects of life. This awareness leads to unity and balance.

sanskrit: रसोहमहं अप्सु कौन्तेय प्रभास्मि शशिसूर्ययो:। प्रणव: सर्ववेदेषु शब्द: खे पौरुषं नृषु॥
translation: I am the taste in water, the light of the sun and moon, the syllable Om in the Vedas, the sound in ether, and ability in man.
explanation: Find divinity in everyday elements around you. This perception transforms mundane activities into a spiritual experience.

sanskrit: पुण्यो गन्ध: पृथिव्यां च तेजश्चास्मि विभावसौ। जीवनं सर्वभूतेषु तपश्चास्मि तपस्विषु॥
translation: I am the pure fragrance of the earth, the brilliance in fire, life in all beings, and austerity in ascetics.
explanation: Focus on purity, vitality, and discipline to connect with the divine essence in all aspects of life.

sanskrit: बीजं मां सर्वभूतानां विद्धि पार्थ सनातनम्। बुद्धिर्बुद्धिमतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम्॥
translation: Know that I am the eternal seed of all beings, the intelligence of the intelligent, and the splendor of the splendid.
explanation: Tap into your innate potential by acknowledging the divine source of all qualities. This fosters confidence and creativity.

sanskrit: बलं बलवतां चाहं कामरागविवर्जितम्। धर्माविरुद्धो भूतेषु कामोऽस्मि भरतर्षभ॥
translation: I am the strength of the strong, devoid of desire and attachment. I am desire that is in harmony with dharma, O best of the Bharatas.
explanation: Strength is virtuous only when it is free from selfish desires and attachments. Align your desires with dharma to ensure they are constructive and beneficial.

sanskrit: ये चैव सात्त्विका भावाः राजसास्तामसाश्च ये। मत्त एवेति तान्विद्धि न त्वहं तेषु ते मयि॥
translation: All states of being—be they of goodness, passion, or ignorance—are born of Me. But I am not in them; they are in Me.
explanation: Understand that all qualities originate from the divine, but the divine remains unaffected by them. This knowledge helps in remaining detached while navigating various emotions.

sanskrit: त्रिभिर्गुणमयैर्भावैरेभिः सर्वमिदं जगत्। मोहितं नाभिजानाति मामेभ्यः परमव्ययम्॥
translation: Deluded by the three modes of material nature, the world does not recognize Me as beyond them and imperishable.
explanation: Recognizing higher truths requires transcending the influence of material nature. Awareness is the first step to breaking free from delusion.

sanskrit: दैवी ह्येषा गुणमयी मम माया दुरत्यया। मामेव ये प्रपद्यन्ते मायामेतां तरन्ति ते॥
translation: This divine energy of Mine, consisting of the three modes of material nature, is difficult to overcome. But those who surrender unto Me can easily cross beyond it.
explanation: Surrendering to a higher power helps in overcoming life’s challenges and limitations, just as reliance on divine grace transcends material entanglement.

sanskrit: न मां दुष्कृतिनो मूढाः प्रपद्यन्ते नराधमाः। माययापहृतज्ञाना आसुरं भावमाश्रिताः॥
translation: The miscreants, the deluded, and the lowest of mankind, whose knowledge is stolen by illusion, do not surrender to Me. They take shelter in the demonic nature.
explanation: Ignorance and negative tendencies block progress. Identify and avoid actions driven by ego or illusion to cultivate a higher mindset.

sanskrit: चतुर्विधा भजन्ते मां जनाः सुकृतिनोऽर्जुन। आर्तो जिज्ञासुरर्थार्थी ज्ञानी च भरतर्षभ॥
translation: O Arjuna, four kinds of pious people worship Me—the distressed, the inquisitive, the seekers of wealth, and the wise.
explanation: Each person approaches the divine from their unique perspective. Accepting this diversity helps in building empathy and understanding.

sanskrit: तेषां ज्ञानी नित्ययुक्त एकभक्तिर्विशिष्यते। प्रियohi ज्ञानिनोऽत्यर्थमहं स च मम प्रियः॥
translation: Among them, the wise, who are always in union with Me through devotion, are superior. I am very dear to the wise, and they are dear to Me.
explanation: Wisdom and unwavering devotion lead to a special bond with the divine. Cultivate knowledge and focus to deepen your connection.

sanskrit: उदाराः सर्व एवैते ज्ञानी त्वात्मैव मे मतम्। आस्थितः स हि युक्तात्मा मामेवानुत्तमां गतिम्॥
translation: All these are indeed noble, but the wise one is like My own self. Steadfast in mind, they focus exclusively on Me as the ultimate goal.
explanation: While all paths are valuable, the pursuit of wisdom combined with singular focus yields the greatest fulfillment.

sanskrit: बहूनां जन्मनामन्ते ज्ञानवान्मां प्रपद्यते। वासुदेवः सर्वमिति स महात्मा सुदुर्लभः॥
translation: After many births, the wise surrender unto Me, realizing that Vasudeva is everything. Such a great soul is very rare.
explanation: True understanding and surrender often require prolonged effort. Patience and perseverance are essential in spiritual growth.

sanskrit: कामैस्तैस्तैर्हृतज्ञानाः प्रपद्यन्तेऽन्यदेवताः। तं तं नियममास्थाय प्रकृत्या नियता स्वया॥
translation: Those whose wisdom is stolen by desires worship other deities, following rules and regulations according to their own natures.
explanation: Desires can divert focus. Cultivate discernment to align your actions with your highest values and purpose.

sanskrit: यो यो यां यां तनुं भक्तः श्रद्धयार्चितुमिच्छति। तस्य तस्याचलां श्रद्धां तामेव विदधाम्यहम्॥
translation: Whichever form a devotee seeks to worship with faith, I make that faith steady for them.
explanation: Faith is supported and nurtured by the divine, irrespective of the chosen path. Recognizing this helps foster respect for diverse beliefs and practices.

sanskrit: स तया श्रद्धया युक्तस्तस्याराधनमीहते। लभते च ततः कामान्मयैव विहितान्हि तान्॥
translation: Endowed with that faith, they worship their chosen form and obtain their desires, as ordained by Me.
explanation: Desires fulfilled through faith are ultimately guided by divine will. Trust in divine timing and effort towards worthy goals.

sanskrit: अन्तवत्तु फलं तेषां तद्भवत्यल्पमेधसाम्। देवान्देवयजो यान्ति मद्भक्ता यान्ति मामपि॥
translation: The results gained by these people are temporary. Those who worship deities go to the deities, but My devotees come to Me.
explanation: Temporary rewards are limited, while devotion to the eternal leads to lasting fulfillment. Focus on higher aspirations rather than transient gains.

sanskrit: अव्यक्तं व्यक्तिमापन्नं मन्यन्ते मामबुद्धयः। परं भावमजानन्तो ममाव्ययमनुत्तमम्॥
translation: The ignorant think of Me as having a material form, not knowing My higher, immutable, and supreme nature.
explanation: Understanding the deeper nature of reality requires transcending surface-level perceptions. Strive to see beyond appearances to grasp the eternal truth.

sanskrit: नाहं प्रकाशः सर्वस्य योगमायासमावृतः। मूढोऽयं नाभिजानाति लोको मामजमव्ययम्॥
translation: I am not manifest to everyone, veiled by My divine energy. The deluded world does not know Me as unborn and eternal.
explanation: Divine truth is often hidden by illusions. Overcoming delusion requires self-awareness and dedication to spiritual practice.

sanskrit: वेदाहं समतीतानि वर्तमानानि चार्जुन। भविष्याणि च भूतानि मां तु वेद न कश्चन॥
translation: I know all beings—past, present, and future—but no one knows Me completely.
explanation: The divine comprehends all, while human understanding is limited. Embrace humility and openness in the quest for knowledge.

sanskrit: इच्छाद्वेषसमुत्थेन द्वन्द्वमोहेन भारत। सर्वभूतानि संमोहं सर्गे यान्ति परंतप॥
translation: By the dualities of desire and aversion, all beings are deluded at birth, O Arjuna.
explanation: Desire and aversion lead to confusion. Cultivating equanimity helps in overcoming these dualities and achieving clarity.

sanskrit: येषां त्वन्तगतं पापं जनानां पुण्यकर्मणाम्। ते द्वन्द्वमोहनिर्मुक्ता भजन्ते मां दृढव्रताः॥
translation: Those who have purified their sins through virtuous deeds and are freed from the delusion of dualities worship Me with determination.
explanation: Virtuous actions clear mental barriers and enable focused devotion. Align actions with virtue to progress spiritually.

sanskrit: जरामरणमोक्षाय मामाश्रित्य यतन्ति ये। ते ब्रह्म तद्विदुः कृत्स्नमध्यात्मं कर्म चाखिलम्॥
translation: Those who strive for liberation from old age and death, taking refuge in Me, come to know Brahman, the Self, and the entirety of karma.
explanation: Seeking liberation involves understanding the eternal self and the principles of action. Dedication to self-realization leads to ultimate freedom.

sanskrit: साधिभूताधिदैवं मां साधियज्ञं च ये विदुः। प्रयाणकालेऽपि च मां ते विदुर्युक्तचेतसः॥
translation: Those who know Me as the governing principle of all beings, gods, and sacrifices, even at the time of death, their consciousness remains steadfast in Me.
explanation: Understanding the divine essence provides peace even in life's ultimate transitions. Cultivate spiritual awareness to maintain clarity in all circumstances.

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। किं तद्ब्रह्म किमध्यात्मं किं कर्म पुरुषोत्तम। अधिभूतं च किं प्रोक्तमधिदैवं किमुच्यते॥
translation: Arjuna said: What is Brahman? What is the self? What is action, O Supreme Person? What is called the material realm, and what is the divine realm?
explanation: When seeking clarity on concepts, ask direct questions. Understanding the nature of existence, self, and action helps make sense of life’s purpose.

sanskrit: अधियज्ञः कथं कोऽत्र देहेऽस्मिन्मधुसूदन। प्रयाणकाले च कथं ज्ञेयोऽसि नियतात्मभिः॥
translation: Who is the lord of sacrifice within the body, O Madhusudana? And how can those who are self-controlled know You at the time of death?
explanation: Understanding your inner self and the role of dedication can prepare you for life’s critical moments. Cultivate discipline for spiritual awareness.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। अक्षरं ब्रह्म परमं स्वभावोऽध्यात्ममुच्यते। भूतभावोद्भवकरो विसर्गः कर्मसंज्ञितः॥
translation: The Blessed Lord said: The Supreme, indestructible entity is Brahman. The self is one’s inherent nature, and action pertains to the creation and development of beings.
explanation: Recognize your true nature and purpose. Align actions with your higher self to foster growth and fulfillment.

sanskrit: अधिभूतं क्षरो भावः पुरुषश्चाधिदैवतम्। अधियज्ञोऽहमेवात्र देहे देहभृतां वर॥
translation: The material world is perishable, and the divine realm is the Cosmic Person. I am the Lord of Sacrifice, residing in the body, O best of embodied beings.
explanation: Acknowledge the temporary nature of the world and focus on your spiritual essence. This awareness fosters detachment and devotion.

sanskrit: अन्तकाले च मामेव स्मरन्मुक्त्वा कलेवरम्। यः प्रयाति स मद्भावं याति नास्त्यत्र संशयः॥
translation: Whoever remembers Me at the time of death, leaving the body, attains My nature. Of this, there is no doubt.
explanation: Maintain a focused mind and remember your purpose during crucial times. Consistent spiritual practice leads to peace in life and beyond.

sanskrit: यं यं वापि स्मरन्भावं त्यजत्यन्ते कलेवरम्। तं तमेवैति कौन्तेय सदा तद्भावभावितः॥
translation: Whatever one remembers at the time of death, that state they attain, O Kaunteya, as they have been constantly absorbed in it.
explanation: Your dominant thoughts shape your destiny. Cultivate positive and meaningful thoughts to guide your life’s outcomes.

sanskrit: तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु मामनुस्मर युध्य च। मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्मामेवैष्यस्यसंशयः॥
translation: Therefore, at all times, remember Me and fight. With your mind and intellect fixed on Me, you will certainly come to Me.
explanation: Balance your duties with spiritual mindfulness. Focused action and dedication to a higher purpose ensure success.

sanskrit: अभ्यासयोगयुक्तेन चेतसा नान्यगामिना। परं पुरुषं दिव्यं याति पार्थानुचिन्तयन्॥
translation: With a mind disciplined through yoga and focused on the Supreme Person, one attains the divine goal.
explanation: Regular practice and unwavering focus on your goal help achieve excellence. Discipline strengthens inner resolve.

sanskrit: कविं पुराणमनुशासितारमणोरणीयांसमनुस्मरेद्यः। सर्वस्य धातारमचिन्त्यरूपमादित्यवर्णं तमसः परस्तात्॥
translation: He who remembers the omniscient, ancient, the ruler smaller than an atom, the sustainer of all, with an inconceivable form, luminous like the sun, beyond darkness.
explanation: Remember the divine as all-knowing and guiding your path. Trust in a higher power to overcome challenges.

sanskrit: प्रयाणकाले मनसाचलेन भक्त्या युक्तो योगबलेन चैव। भ्रुवोर्मध्ये प्राणमावेश्य सम्यक् स तं परं पुरुषमुपैति दिव्यम्॥
translation: At the time of death, with a steady mind, devotion, and the power of yoga, focusing between the eyebrows, one attains the divine Supreme Person.
explanation: In critical moments, maintain composure and devotion. A focused mind ensures peaceful transitions.

sanskrit: यदक्षरं वेदविदो वदन्ति विशन्ति यद्यतयो वीतरागाः। यदिच्छन्तो ब्रह्मचर्यं चरन्ति तत्ते पदं सङ्ग्रहेण प्रवक्ष्ये॥
translation: That which the knowers of the Vedas declare as imperishable, into which the self-disciplined enter, desiring which they practice celibacy—this I shall briefly explain to you.
explanation: Focus on higher knowledge and discipline to reach your goals. Desire for ultimate truth requires sacrifice and commitment.

sanskrit: सर्वद्वाराणि संयम्य मनो हृदि निरुध्य च। मूर्ध्न्याधायात्मनः प्राणमास्थितो योगधारणाम्॥
translation: With all the doors of the senses restrained, the mind confined in the heart, and life energy fixed in the head, one practices yogic concentration.
explanation: Controlling your senses and focusing your energy can help maintain concentration and achieve deep meditation. Discipline leads to clarity.

sanskrit: ओमित्येकाक्षरं ब्रह्म व्याहरन्मामनुस्मरन्। यः प्रयाति त्यजन्देहं स याति परमां गतिम्॥
translation: Chanting the one-syllabled Om, and remembering Me as they leave the body, one attains the supreme goal.
explanation: Maintain a steady mind with the power of Om and remembrance of a higher purpose. Focused devotion leads to peace and liberation.

sanskrit: अनन्यचेताः सततं यो मां स्मरति नित्यशः। तस्याहं सुलभः पार्थ नित्ययुक्तस्य योगिनः॥
translation: For one who always remembers Me without deviation, I am easy to obtain, O Partha, because of their constant engagement in devotion.
explanation: Consistent dedication and devotion simplify achieving life goals. Stay focused on your purpose for ease in your journey.

sanskrit: मामुपेत्य पुनर्जन्म दुःखालयमशाश्वतम्। नाप्नुवन्ति महात्मानः संसिद्धिं परमां गताः॥
translation: Having attained Me, great souls do not take birth again in this world, which is temporary and full of suffering; they attain supreme perfection.
explanation: Strive for higher aspirations to break free from recurring struggles. Ultimate success lies in transcending temporary challenges.

sanskrit: आ ब्रह्मभुवनाल्लोकाः पुनरावर्तिनोऽर्जुन। मामुपेत्य तु कौन्तेय पुनर्जन्म न विद्यते॥
translation: From the highest planet in the material world down to the lowest, all are places of rebirth. But having reached Me, O Kaunteya, one does not take birth again.
explanation: Even the highest achievements in life are temporary. Focus on spiritual growth for lasting fulfillment.

sanskrit: सहस्रयुगपर्यन्तमहर्यद्ब्रह्मणो विदुः। रात्रिं युगसहस्रान्तां तेऽहोरात्रविदो जनाः॥
translation: Those who know the cosmic day and night understand that one day of Brahma lasts a thousand cycles of four ages, and his night is of the same duration.
explanation: Understand the bigger picture and be patient. Time and effort lead to results over extended periods.

sanskrit: अव्यक्ताद्व्यक्तयः सर्वाः प्रभवन्त्यहरागमे। रात्र्यागमे प्रलीयन्ते तत्रैवाव्यक्तसंज्ञके॥
translation: All living beings emerge from the unmanifest state at the dawn of day, and at dusk, they merge into the unmanifest again.
explanation: Life operates in cycles. Accept changes and adapt to new beginnings with resilience.

sanskrit: भूतग्रामः स एवायं भूत्वा भूत्वा प्रलीयते। रात्र्यागमेऽवशः पार्थ प्रभवत्यहरागमे॥
translation: This multitude of beings repeatedly comes into existence at the arrival of day, and with nightfall, it is helplessly dissolved.
explanation: Recognize the cycles of creation and dissolution in life. Embrace each phase with balance and acceptance.

sanskrit: परस्तस्मात्तु भावोन्योऽव्यक्तोऽव्यक्तात्सनातनः। यः स सर्वेषु भूतेषु नश्यत्सु न विनश्यति॥
translation: Beyond this unmanifest is another eternal unmanifest reality that does not perish even when all beings perish.
explanation: Focus on the eternal truths beyond temporary life situations. Connecting to the unchanging brings peace and stability.

sanskrit: अव्यक्तोऽक्षर इत्युक्तस्तमाहुः परमां गतिम्। यं प्राप्य न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम॥
translation: The unmanifest and imperishable is called the ultimate goal. Those who attain it never return; that is My supreme abode.
explanation: Pursue goals that provide lasting fulfillment. Focus on self-improvement and achieving higher objectives for long-term success.

sanskrit: पुरुषः स परः पार्थ भक्त्या लभ्यस्त्वनन्यया। यस्यान्तःस्थितानि भूतानि येन सर्वमिदं ततम्॥
translation: That supreme person can be attained by exclusive devotion, O Partha, within whom all beings exist and by whom all this is pervaded.
explanation: Cultivate devotion and focus on the greater purpose of life. Exclusive commitment leads to achieving the highest potential.

sanskrit: यत्र काले त्वनावृत्तिमावृत्तिं चैव योगिनः। प्रयाता यान्ति तं कालं वक्ष्यामि भरतर्षभ॥
translation: I will now explain the time at which, departing, yogis do not return and the time at which they return.
explanation: Understand the importance of timing and take actions at the right moment to achieve desired outcomes.

sanskrit: अग्निर्ज्योतिरहः शुक्लः षण्मासा उत्तरायणम्। तत्र प्रयाता गच्छन्ति ब्रह्म ब्रह्मविदो जनाः॥
translation: Fire, light, day, the bright fortnight, and the six months of the northern solstice—departing by this path, the knowers of Brahman attain Brahman.
explanation: Align your efforts with favorable conditions for success. Take advantage of opportunities when circumstances are favorable.

sanskrit: धूमो रात्रिस्तथा कृष्णः षण्मासा दक्षिणायनम्। तत्र चान्द्रमसं ज्योतिर्योगी प्राप्य निवर्तते॥
translation: Smoke, night, the dark fortnight, and the six months of the southern solstice—taking this path, the yogi attains the lunar light and returns.
explanation: Understand that some paths lead to temporary success. Aim for lasting achievements by choosing the right direction.

sanskrit: शुक्लकृष्णे गती ह्येते जगतः शाश्वते मते। एकया यात्यनावृत्तिमन्ययावर्तते पुनः॥
translation: These two paths of the world, the bright and the dark, are considered eternal. By one, one attains liberation; by the other, one returns.
explanation: Life offers different paths—some leading to liberation and some to repetition of efforts. Choose wisely to avoid repetitive cycles.

sanskrit: नैते सृती पार्थ जानन्योगी मुह्यति कश्चन। तस्मात्सर्वेषु कालेषु योगयुक्तो भवार्जुन॥
translation: Knowing these paths, a yogi is never deluded. Therefore, always remain steadfast in yoga, O Arjuna.
explanation: Knowledge eliminates confusion. Stay aware and connected to your purpose to avoid distractions.

sanskrit: वेदेषु यज्ञेषु तपःसु चैव। दानेषु यत्पुण्यफलं प्रदिष्टम्। अत्येति तत्सर्वमिदं विदित्वा। योगी परं स्थानमुपैति चाद्यम्॥
translation: Knowing all this, the yogi transcends the rewards of Vedic study, sacrifices, austerities, and charity, and attains the supreme, eternal abode.
explanation: True knowledge surpasses all external achievements. Focus on inner growth and wisdom for ultimate success.

sanskrit: इदं तु ते गुह्यतमं प्रवक्ष्याम्यनसूयवे। ज्ञानं विज्ञानसहितं यज्ज्ञात्वा मोक्ष्यसेऽशुभात्॥
translation: I shall now impart to you the most confidential knowledge, along with wisdom, which will free you from all misfortune.
explanation: Seek both knowledge and experiential wisdom to overcome challenges and achieve freedom from distress. Applying knowledge practically leads to true liberation.

sanskrit: राजविद्या राजगुह्यं पवित्रमिदमुत्तमम्। प्रत्यक्षावगमं धर्म्यं सुसुखं कर्तुमव्ययम्॥
translation: This is the king of knowledge and the king of secrets, the purest knowledge. It gives direct perception of the self, is in accordance with dharma, easy to practice, and everlasting.
explanation: Pursue knowledge that aligns with your values, is practical, and provides lasting benefits. Focus on learning that brings clarity and ease in life.

sanskrit: अश्रद्दधानाः पुरुषा धर्मस्यास्य परंतप। अप्राप्य मां निवर्तन्ते मृत्युसंसारवर्त्मनि॥
translation: Those who lack faith in this dharma do not attain Me and return to the cycle of birth and death.
explanation: Faith and conviction are crucial for success. Without belief in one's path, progress becomes difficult, leading to repeated struggles.

sanskrit: मया ततमिदं सर्वं जगदव्यक्तमूर्तिना। मत्स्थानि सर्वभूतानि न चाहं तेष्ववस्थितः॥
translation: By Me, in My unmanifest form, this entire universe is pervaded. All beings are in Me, but I am not in them.
explanation: Understand that while external conditions affect you, your true self remains unattached. Focus on your inner strength to overcome external challenges.

sanskrit: न च मत्स्थानि भूतानि पश्य मे योगमैश्वरम्। भूतभृन्न च भूतस्थो ममात्मा भूतभावनः॥
translation: Behold My divine yoga! Although I am the sustainer of all beings, I am not in them, and My Self creates and nurtures all beings.
explanation: Embrace a balanced life where you support others without being overwhelmed by their burdens. Balance self-care with responsibilities.

sanskrit: यथाकाशस्थितो नित्यं वायुः सर्वत्रगो महान्। तथा सर्वाणि भूतानि मत्स्थानीत्युपधारय॥
translation: Just as the mighty wind, moving everywhere, rests always in the sky, so do all beings rest in Me.
explanation: Like the wind, which moves freely yet stays connected to its source, stay flexible in life but grounded in your values and purpose.

sanskrit: सर्वभूतानि कौन्तेय प्रकृतिं यान्ति मामिकाम्। कल्पक्षये पुनस्तानि कल्पादौ विसृजाम्यहम्॥
translation: All beings enter My nature at the end of a cycle, and I send them forth again at the beginning of the next cycle.
explanation: Life moves in cycles. Embrace change and new beginnings as opportunities for growth and renewal.

sanskrit: प्रकृतिं स्वामवष्टभ्य विसृजामि पुनः पुनः। भूतग्राममिमं कृत्स्नमवशं प्रकृतेर्वशात्॥
translation: Taking control of My nature, I create again and again all living beings, who are helplessly controlled by nature.
explanation: Accept that some things are beyond control. Focus on what you can influence and let go of what you cannot change.

sanskrit: न च मां तानि कर्माणि निबध्नन्ति धनञ्जय। उदासीनवदासीनमसक्तं तेषु कर्मसु॥
translation: These actions do not bind Me, O Dhananjaya, as I remain detached and indifferent to their outcomes.
explanation: Perform your duties without attachment to the results. Detachment helps in maintaining peace and focus.

sanskrit: मयाध्यक्षेण प्रकृतिः सूयते सचराचरम्। हेतुनानेन कौन्तेय जगद्विपरिवर्तते॥
translation: Under My supervision, nature produces all moving and non-moving beings, and thus the world evolves.
explanation: Recognize the higher forces at play in life. Trust the process and work in harmony with it.

sanskrit: अवजानन्ति मां मूढा मानुषीं तनुमाश्रितम्। परं भावमजानन्तो मम भूतमहेश्वरम्॥
translation: Fools deride Me when I appear in a human form, not knowing My higher nature as the Supreme Lord of all beings.
explanation: Do not judge others based on appearances. True greatness often lies beyond what is visible.

sanskrit: मोहाशा मोघकर्माणो मोघज्ञाना विचेतसः। राक्षसीमासुरीं चैव प्रकृतिं मोहिनीं श्रिताः॥
translation: Those whose hopes, actions, and knowledge are futile, who are devoid of wisdom, are possessed by a deluding, demoniac nature.
explanation: Negative thinking and ignorance lead to failure and delusion. Cultivate positive thoughts and wisdom to achieve meaningful results.

sanskrit: महात्मानस्तु मां पार्थ दैवीं प्रकृतिमाश्रिताः। भजन्त्यनन्यमनसो ज्ञात्वा भूतादिमव्ययम्॥
translation: The great souls, taking shelter of divine nature, worship Me with undivided attention, knowing Me as the eternal source of all beings.
explanation: Focus on higher goals with unwavering dedication. Align your actions with your true purpose to find fulfillment.

sanskrit: सततं कीर्तयन्तो मां यतन्यश्च दृढव्रताः। नमस्यन्तश्च मां भक्त्या नित्ययुक्ता उपासते॥
translation: Always glorifying Me, striving with firm vows, and bowing with devotion, they worship Me constantly, ever united with Me.
explanation: Consistency and devotion in your efforts bring success. Stay committed to your goals and honor the process.

sanskrit: ज्ञानयज्ञेन चाप्यन्ये यजन्तो मामुपासते। एकत्वेन पृथक्त्वेन बहुधा विश्वतोमुखम्॥
translation: Others worship Me through the sacrifice of knowledge, seeing Me as one or as many, in diverse forms everywhere.
explanation: Knowledge can be applied in multiple ways. Be open to different perspectives to solve problems creatively.

sanskrit: अहं क्रतुरहं यज्ञः स्वधाहमहमौषधम्। मन्त्रोहमहमेवाज्यमहमग्निरहं हुतम्॥
translation: I am the ritual, the sacrifice, the offering to ancestors, the healing herb, the mantra, the clarified butter, the fire, and the offering itself.
explanation: Recognize that everything is interconnected. Approach tasks holistically to achieve balance and harmony.

sanskrit: पिताहमस्य जगतो माता धाता पितामहः। वेद्यं पवित्रमोंकार ऋक्साम यजुरेव च॥
translation: I am the father, mother, sustainer, and grandfather of this universe. I am the purifier, the sacred syllable Om, and the Vedas—Rig, Sama, and Yajur.
explanation: Acknowledge multiple sources of support in your life. Draw strength from family, tradition, and knowledge.

sanskrit: गतिरभर्ता प्रभुः साक्षी निवासः शरणं सुहृत्। प्रभवः प्रलयः स्थानं निधानं बीजमव्ययम्॥
translation: I am the goal, the sustainer, the Lord, the witness, the abode, the refuge, the well-wisher, the origin, dissolution, foundation, and eternal seed.
explanation: In times of uncertainty, find refuge in a stable source, whether it be your values, a mentor, or a spiritual guide.

sanskrit: तपाम्यहमहं वर्षं निगृह्णाम्युत्सृजामि च। अमृतं चैव मृत्युश्च सदसच्चाहमर्जुन॥
translation: I give heat, I withhold and send forth rain; I am immortality and death, and also the manifest and the unmanifest, O Arjuna.
explanation: Life is a balance of opposites. Embrace both success and failure as part of the journey.

sanskrit: त्रैविद्या मां सोमपा पूतपापा यज्ञैरिष्ट्वा स्वर्गतिं प्रार्थयन्ते। ते पुण्यमासाद्य सुरेन्द्रलोकं अश्नन्ति दिव्यान्दिवि देवभोगान्॥
translation: Those who study the Vedas and drink the soma juice, purified of sin, worship Me through sacrifices and seek heaven. They enjoy the celestial pleasures of the gods in heaven.
explanation: Short-term pleasures are temporary. Focus on lasting fulfillment through meaningful actions.

sanskrit: ते तं भुक्त्वा स्वर्गलोकं विशालं क्षीणे पुण्ये मर्त्यलोकं विशन्ति। एवं त्रयीधर्ममनुप्रपन्ना गतागतं कामकामा लभन्ते॥
translation: After enjoying the vast heaven, when their merits are exhausted, they return to the mortal world. Thus, those who follow the path of desire keep coming and going.
explanation: Chasing desires leads to a cycle of highs and lows. Seek contentment beyond temporary pleasures.

sanskrit: अनन्याश्चिन्तयन्तो मां ये जनाः पर्युपासते। तेषां नित्याभियुक्तानां योगक्षेमं वहाम्यहम्॥
translation: Those who worship Me with unwavering devotion, constantly thinking of Me, I carry what they lack and preserve what they have.
explanation: Trust that sincere efforts will be supported. Stay focused on your goals, and the necessary resources will follow.

sanskrit: येऽप्यन्यदेवताभक्ता यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः। तेऽपि मामेव कौन्तेय यजन्त्यविधिपूर्वकम्॥
translation: Even those who worship other gods with faith actually worship Me alone, O Kaunteya, though not in the prescribed way.
explanation: When efforts are misdirected, the results may be limited. Focus on the correct path for optimal success, aligning your actions with core goals.

sanskrit: अहं हि सर्वयज्ञानां भोक्ता च प्रभुरेव च। न तु मामभिजानन्ति तत्त्वेनातश्च्यवन्ति ते॥
translation: I am the only enjoyer and Lord of all sacrifices, yet they do not recognize Me in truth and thus fall.
explanation: Understanding the true purpose behind actions prevents failure. Seek clarity in your goals and their significance to avoid setbacks.

sanskrit: यान्ति देवव्रता देवान् पितॄन्यान्ति पितृव्रताः। भूतानि यान्ति भूतेज्या यान्ति मद्याजिनोऽपि माम्॥
translation: Those who worship the gods go to the gods; those who worship ancestors go to them; those who worship spirits go to the spirits; but those who worship Me come to Me.
explanation: You achieve what you focus on. Direct your efforts toward higher, meaningful objectives to reach your desired destination.

sanskrit: पत्रं पुष्पं फलं तोयं यो मे भक्त्या प्रयच्छति। तदहं भक्त्युपहृतमश्नामि प्रयतात्मनः॥
translation: Whoever offers Me with devotion a leaf, a flower, a fruit, or water, I accept that pious offering of the pure-hearted.
explanation: Sincere effort, no matter how small, is valuable. Offer your best with devotion, and it will be accepted and rewarded.

sanskrit: यत्करोषि यदश्नासि यज्जुहोषि ददासि यत्। यत्तपस्यसि कौन्तेय तत्कुरुष्व मदर्पणम्॥
translation: Whatever you do, eat, offer, or give away, and whatever austerities you perform, do that as an offering to Me.
explanation: Dedicate all your actions to a higher purpose. This mindset transforms ordinary tasks into meaningful contributions.

sanskrit: शुभाशुभफलैरेवं मोक्ष्यसे कर्मबन्धनैः। संन्यासयोगयुक्तात्मा विमुक्तो मामुपैष्यसि॥
translation: By dedicating your actions, you will be freed from good and bad results and attain liberation.
explanation: Let go of attachment to outcomes. Focus on sincere efforts, and freedom from stress will follow.

sanskrit: समोऽहं सर्वभूतेषु न मे द्वेष्योऽस्ति न प्रियः। ये भजन्ति तु मां भक्त्या मयि ते तेषु चाप्यहम्॥
translation: I am equal to all beings; I have no one I dislike or favor. But those who worship Me with devotion are in Me, and I am in them.
explanation: Treat everyone equally and fairly. Building relationships based on respect and devotion leads to mutual support.

sanskrit: अपि चेत्सुदुराचारो भजते मामनन्यभाक्। साधुरेव स मन्तव्यः सम्यग्व्यवसितो हि सः॥
translation: Even if a person of poor conduct worships Me with unwavering devotion, they should be considered righteous, for they are properly resolved.
explanation: Past mistakes do not define you. Consistent devotion and right intent can lead to transformation and redemption.

sanskrit: क्षिप्रं भवति धर्मात्मा शश्वच्छान्तिं निगच्छति। कौन्तेय प्रतिजानीहि न मे भक्तः प्रणश्यति॥
translation: They quickly become righteous and attain lasting peace. Declare boldly, O Kaunteya, that My devotee never perishes.
explanation: Trust in the process of self-improvement. Perseverance in devotion and right action leads to peace and success.

sanskrit: मां हि पार्थ व्यपाश्रित्य येऽपि स्यु: पापयोनयः। स्त्रियो वैश्यास्तथा शूद्रास्तेऽपि यान्ति परां गतिम्॥
translation: Even those of low birth, women, Vaishyas, and Shudras can attain the supreme goal by taking refuge in Me.
explanation: Everyone has equal potential for greatness, regardless of their background. Seek refuge in your strengths and strive for excellence.

sanskrit: किं पुनर्ब्राह्मणाः पुण्या भक्ता राजर्षयस्तथा। अनित्यमसुखं लोकं इमं प्राप्य भजस्व माम्॥
translation: How much more, then, righteous Brahmanas and devout royal sages! Having come to this temporary, joyless world, worship Me.
explanation: Recognize the transient nature of life. Focus on what truly matters and dedicate yourself to higher pursuits.

sanskrit: मन्मना भव मद्भक्तो मद्याजी मां नमस्कुरु। मामेवैष्यसि युक्त्वैवमात्मानं मत्परायणः॥
translation: Fix your mind on Me, be devoted to Me, sacrifice for Me, and bow to Me. Thus, you will come to Me, having your self-disciplined and devoted to Me.
explanation: Focus your thoughts and actions on a single goal. Devotion and discipline lead to ultimate success.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। भूय एव महाबाहो शृणु मे परमं वचः। यत्तेऽहं प्रीयमाणाय वक्ष्यामि हितकाम्यया॥
translation: The Blessed Lord said: Listen again, O mighty-armed Arjuna, to My supreme words, which I speak for your benefit, as you are dear to Me.
explanation: Guidance from a trusted source can provide clarity and direction. Seek advice from those who genuinely care for your well-being.

sanskrit: न मे विदुः सुरगणाः प्रभवं न महर्षयः। अहमादिर्हि देवानां महर्षीणां च सर्वशः॥
translation: Neither the gods nor the great sages know My origin, for I am the source of all gods and sages.
explanation: Understanding the root cause of situations is crucial. Explore deeper to identify the true source of challenges and solutions.

sanskrit: यो मामजमनादिं च वेत्ति लोकमहेश्वरम्। असंमूढः स मर्त्येषु सर्वपापैः प्रमुच्यते॥
translation: One who knows Me as unborn, without beginning, and the supreme lord of all worlds is undeluded and freed from all sins.
explanation: Clarity of understanding leads to freedom from confusion and mistakes. Gain knowledge to navigate life with confidence.

sanskrit: बुद्धिर्ज्ञानमसंमोहः क्षमा सत्यं दमः शमः। सुखं दुःखं भवोऽभावो भयं चाभयमेव च॥
translation: Intelligence, knowledge, freedom from delusion, forgiveness, truthfulness, self-control, tranquility, happiness, pain, birth, death, fear, and fearlessness.
explanation: Cultivate qualities such as patience, truth, and self-control to handle life's ups and downs effectively.

sanskrit: अहिंसा समता तुष्टिः तपो दानं यशोऽयशः। भवन्ति भावा भूतानां मत्त एव पृथग्विधाः॥
translation: Non-violence, equanimity, contentment, austerity, charity, fame, and infamy—all these diverse qualities arise from Me.
explanation: Embrace virtues like non-violence and contentment to lead a balanced life. Accept both praise and criticism with grace.

sanskrit: महर्षयः सप्त पूर्वे चत्वारो मनवस्तथा। मद्भावा मानसा जाता येषां लोक इमाः प्रजाः॥
translation: The seven great sages and the four Manus, born from My mind, originated from Me, and from them all creatures in the world have descended.
explanation: Understanding the origins of systems and processes helps in better management. Learn the history to appreciate the present.

sanskrit: एतां विभूतिं योगं च मम यो वेत्ति तत्त्वतः। सोऽविकम्पेन योगेन युज्यते नात्र संशयः॥
translation: One who truly understands My divine glories and mystic power is undoubtedly established in unshakable yoga.
explanation: Recognizing strengths and capabilities fosters confidence and stability. Focus on your unique attributes to stay grounded.

sanskrit: अहं सर्वस्य प्रभवो मत्तः सर्वं प्रवर्तते। इति मत्वा भजन्ते मां बुधा भावसमन्विताः॥
translation: I am the origin of all creation; everything proceeds from Me. Knowing this, the wise worship Me with devotion.
explanation: Acknowledge the source of your resources and opportunities. Gratitude and devotion enhance focus and success.

sanskrit: मच्चित्ताः मद्गतप्राणाः बोधयन्तः परस्परम्। कथयन्तश्च मां नित्यं तुष्यन्ति च रमन्ति च॥
translation: With their minds fixed on Me and their lives surrendered to Me, My devotees enlighten each other and feel immense satisfaction and joy.
explanation: Supportive communities foster growth and happiness. Engage in meaningful conversations to inspire and uplift one another.

sanskrit: तेषां सततयुक्तानां भजतां प्रीतिपूर्वकम्। ददामि बुद्धियोगं तं येन मामुपयान्ति ते॥
translation: To those who are always devoted and worship Me with love, I give the understanding by which they can come to Me.
explanation: Consistent effort and dedication lead to deeper insights. Stay committed to your goals for lasting success.

sanskrit: तेषामेवानुकम्पार्थमहमज्ञानजं तमः। नाशयाम्यात्मभावस्थो ज्ञानदीपेन भास्वता॥
translation: Out of compassion for them, I, dwelling within their hearts, destroy the darkness born of ignorance with the shining lamp of knowledge.
explanation: When facing confusion or lack of clarity, seek knowledge and inner guidance. The light of wisdom can dispel ignorance and illuminate the path forward.

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। परं ब्रह्म परं धाम पवित्रं परमं भवान्। पुरुषं शाश्वतं दिव्यमादिदेवमजं विभुम्॥
translation: Arjuna said: You are the Supreme Brahman, the supreme abode, the ultimate purifier, the eternal divine person, the primal God, unborn and all-pervading.
explanation: Recognizing higher principles and values brings stability and clarity. Align with these principles to maintain focus and purity in actions.

sanskrit: आहुस्त्वामृषयः सर्वे देवर्षिर्नारदस्तथा। असितो देवलो व्यासः स्वयं चैव ब्रवीषि मे॥
translation: All the sages, including Devarshi Narada, Asita, Devala, and Vyasa, proclaim You, and now You Yourself are declaring it to me.
explanation: Trust in credible sources and experienced advisors. Relying on wisdom from trusted mentors ensures sound decision-making.

sanskrit: सर्वमेतदृतं मन्ये यन्मां वदसि केशव। न हि ते भगवन् व्यक्तिं विदुर्देवा न दानवाः॥
translation: I accept as truth all that You have told me, O Krishna. Neither gods nor demons know Your full manifestation.
explanation: Accepting truths beyond immediate comprehension opens doors to greater understanding. Embrace faith in higher knowledge.

sanskrit: स्वयमेवात्मनात्मानं वेत्त्थ त्वं पुरुषोत्तम। भूतभावन भूताश देवदेव जगत्पते॥
translation: You alone know Yourself by Your own power, O Supreme Person, Creator of all beings, Lord of all, God of gods, ruler of the universe.
explanation: Self-awareness is the key to mastering one’s surroundings. Knowing yourself deeply empowers you to lead and create effectively.

sanskrit: वक्तुमर्हस्यशेषेण दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः। याभिर्विभूतिभिर्लोकानिमांस्त्वं व्याप्य तिष्ठसि॥
translation: Please describe in detail Your divine manifestations by which You pervade all these worlds.
explanation: Understanding your capabilities and strengths helps in utilizing them effectively. Explore your potential to influence and contribute.

sanskrit: कथं विद्यामहं योगिंस्त्वां सदा परिचिन्तयन्। केषु केषु च भावेषु चिन्त्योऽसि भगवन्मया॥
translation: How should I, constantly meditating, think of You, O Lord? In what aspects should I think of You?
explanation: Focus and mindfulness are essential for success. Identify key areas of life that require attention and meditate upon them for clarity.

sanskrit: विस्तरेणात्मनो योगं विभूतिं च जनार्दन। भूयः कथय तृप्तिर्हि शृण्वतो नास्ति मेऽमृतम्॥
translation: Please tell me again in detail of Your divine powers and glories. I never tire of hearing Your nectar-like words.
explanation: Continuous learning and seeking knowledge keeps the mind refreshed and engaged. Embrace lifelong learning to stay inspired.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। हन्त ते कथयिष्यामि दिव्या ह्यात्मविभूतयः। प्राधान्यतः कुरुश्रेष्ठ नास्त्यन्तो विस्तरस्य मे॥
translation: The Blessed Lord said: Certainly, I will tell you of My divine manifestations, but only the most prominent ones, for there is no end to My vastness.
explanation: Focusing on key aspects rather than overwhelming details ensures clarity and effective action. Prioritize significant areas for better outcomes.

sanskrit: अहमात्मा गुडाकेश सर्वभूताशयस्थितः। अहमादिश्च मध्यं च भूतानामन्त एव च॥
translation: I am the Self, O Arjuna, seated in the hearts of all creatures. I am the beginning, middle, and end of all beings.
explanation: Recognize the presence of the inner self as a guiding force. Connect with this inner self to find balance and direction in life.

sanskrit: आदित्यानामहं विष्णुर्ज्योतिषां रविरंशुमान्। मरीचिर्मरुतामस्मि नक्षत्राणामहं शशी॥
translation: Among the Adityas, I am Vishnu; among the luminous bodies, I am the radiant sun; among the Maruts, I am Marichi; and among the stars, I am the moon.
explanation: Recognize your unique strengths and focus on them to shine in your field. Just as each celestial body holds importance, know where your talents make the greatest impact.

sanskrit: वेदानां सामवेदोऽस्मि देवानामस्मि वासवः। इन्द्रियाणां मनश्चास्मि भूतानामस्मि चेतना॥
translation: Among the Vedas, I am the Sama Veda; among the gods, I am Indra; among the senses, I am the mind; and among living beings, I am consciousness.
explanation: Focus your mind and consciousness on learning and discipline. The mind, when harnessed well, can be your greatest tool for success.

sanskrit: रुद्राणां शंकरश्चास्मि वित्तेशो यक्षरक्षसाम्। वसूनां पावकश्चास्मि मेरुः शिखरिणामहम्॥
translation: Among the Rudras, I am Shankara; among the Yakshas and Rakshasas, I am Kubera; among the Vasus, I am Agni; and among the mountains, I am Meru.
explanation: In any group or team, aim to be a guiding force or leader. Stand tall and firm like Mount Meru, embodying stability and leadership.

sanskrit: पुरोधसां च मुख्यं मां विद्धि पार्थ बृहस्पतिम्। सेनानीनामहं स्कन्दः सरसामस्मि सागरः॥
translation: Among priests, know Me as Brihaspati; among generals, I am Skanda; and among bodies of water, I am the ocean.
explanation: Seek wisdom and knowledge to guide others effectively, just as Brihaspati does. Approach challenges with the vastness and depth of the ocean.

sanskrit: महर्षीणां भृगुरहं गिरामस्म्येकमक्षरम्। यज्ञानां जपयज्ञोऽस्मि स्थावराणां हिमालयः॥
translation: Among the great sages, I am Bhrigu; among words, I am the sacred syllable 'Om'; among sacrifices, I am the chanting of mantras; and among immovable things, I am the Himalayas.
explanation: Ground yourself in sacred practices and steady pursuits. Consistency and devotion, like the immovable Himalayas, lead to great accomplishments.

sanskrit: अश्वत्थः सर्ववृक्षाणां देवार्षीणां च नारदः। गन्धर्वाणां चित्ररथः सिद्धानां कपिलो मुनिः॥
translation: Among trees, I am the Ashvattha; among divine sages, I am Narada; among Gandharvas, I am Chitraratha; and among perfected beings, I am Kapila.
explanation: Value wisdom and communication, like Narada, to inspire and guide others. Nurture your growth steadily, like the sacred Ashvattha tree.

sanskrit: उच्चैःश्रवसमश्वानां विद्धि माममृतोद्भवम्। ऐरावतं गजेन्द्राणां नराणां च नराधिपम्॥
translation: Among horses, I am Ucchaisravas, born of nectar; among elephants, I am Airavata; and among humans, I am the king.
explanation: Aspire for excellence and leadership. Like the majestic Ucchaisravas and Airavata, stand out with dignity and grace in your endeavors.

sanskrit: आयुधानामहं वज्रं धेनूनामस्मि कामधुक्। प्रजनश्चास्मि कन्दर्पः सर्पाणामस्मि वासुकिः॥
translation: Among weapons, I am the thunderbolt; among cows, I am Kamadhenu; among causes of procreation, I am Cupid; and among serpents, I am Vasuki.
explanation: Channel your energy and potential wisely, like the powerful thunderbolt. Utilize your resources effectively to fulfill desires and goals.

sanskrit: अनन्तश्चास्मि नागानां वरुणो यादसामहम्। पितृणामर्यमा चास्मि यमः संयमतामहम्॥
translation: Among Nagas, I am Ananta; among aquatic beings, I am Varuna; among ancestors, I am Aryama; and among controllers, I am Yama.
explanation: Maintain discipline and self-control. Like Yama, be firm and fair in your actions, ensuring balance and accountability.

sanskrit: प्रह्लादश्चास्मि दैत्यानां कालः कलयतामहम्। मृगाणां च मृगेन्द्रोऽहं वैनतेयश्च पक्षिणाम्॥
translation: Among demons, I am Prahlada; among those who measure time, I am Time; among beasts, I am the lion; and among birds, I am Garuda.
explanation: Even in challenging situations, like Prahlada, maintain devotion and resilience. Manage time effectively, as it is the greatest equalizer.

sanskrit: पवनः पवतामस्मि रामः शस्त्रभृतामहम्। झषाणां मकरश्चास्मि स्त्रोतसामस्मि जाह्नवी॥
translation: Among purifiers, I am the wind; among warriors, I am Rama; among aquatic creatures, I am the makara; and among rivers, I am the Ganges.
explanation: Be a force of positive change, like the wind that purifies. In challenging situations, uphold righteousness and courage, like Rama. Flow with purpose and strength, like the Ganges.

sanskrit: सर्गाणामादिरन्तश्च मध्यं चैवाहमर्जुन। अध्यात्मविद्या विद्यानां वादः प्रवदतामहम्॥
translation: I am the beginning, middle, and end of all creation; among sciences, I am the science of the self; and among debates, I am logical reasoning.
explanation: Embrace self-awareness and continuous learning to navigate life’s challenges. Develop logical reasoning skills to make balanced decisions.

sanskrit: अक्षराणामकारोऽस्मि द्वन्द्वः सामासिकस्य च। अहमेवाक्षयः कालो धाताहं विश्वतोमुखः॥
translation: Among letters, I am 'A'; among compounds, I am the dual; I am infinite time; and I am the sustainer, omnipresent.
explanation: Master the basics and fundamentals (like 'A') in any field. Manage your time effectively and understand its value, as it is infinite yet precious.

sanskrit: मृत्युः सर्वहरश्चाहमुद्भवश्च भविष्यता। कीर्तिः श्रीर्वाक्च नारीणां स्मृतिर्मेधा धृतिः क्षमा॥
translation: I am death, the destroyer of all; I am the origin of future beings. Among women, I am fame, prosperity, speech, memory, intelligence, patience, and forgiveness.
explanation: Accept change as inevitable, like death, and focus on building qualities like patience and forgiveness to navigate life’s uncertainties.

sanskrit: बृहत्साम तथा साम्नां गायत्री छन्दसामहम्। मासानां मार्गशीर्षोऽहमृतूनां कुसुमाकरः॥
translation: Among hymns, I am the Brihatsama; among meters, I am the Gayatri; among months, I am Margashirsha; and among seasons, I am the spring.
explanation: Celebrate your achievements and align your actions with auspicious times, like the month of Margashirsha. Embrace renewal and beauty, like spring, to rejuvenate your efforts.

sanskrit: द्यूतं छलयतामस्मि तेजस्तेजस्विनामहम्। जयोस्मि व्यवसायोस्मि सत्त्वं सत्त्ववतामहम्॥
translation: I am the gambling of the deceitful; I am the brilliance of the brilliant; I am victory, determination, and the strength of the strong.
explanation: Use your strengths wisely and ethically. Cultivate determination and focus to achieve success, and shine with integrity and brilliance in your pursuits.

sanskrit: वृष्णीनां वासुदेवोऽस्मि पाण्डवाना धनंजयः। मुनिनामप्यहं व्यासः कवीनामुशनाः कविः॥
translation: Among the Vrishnis, I am Vasudeva; among the Pandavas, I am Arjuna; among sages, I am Vyasa; and among poets, I am Ushana.
explanation: Be a leader and a seeker of knowledge, like Vyasa. Cultivate skills in your domain to stand out, like Arjuna, with focus and dedication.

sanskrit: दण्डो दमयतामस्मि नीतिरस्मि जिगीषताम्। मौनं चैवास्मि गुह्यानां ज्ञानं ज्ञानवतामहम्॥
translation: I am the punishment among discipliners; I am the strategy of the victorious; I am silence among secrets and knowledge among the wise.
explanation: Discipline and strategic thinking lead to success. Embrace the power of silence and discretion to gain deeper insights and wisdom.

sanskrit: यच्चापि सर्वभूतानां बीजं तदहमर्जुन। न तदस्ति विना यत्स्यान्मया भूतं चराचरम्॥
translation: I am the seed of all beings, O Arjuna. There is no being, moving or non-moving, that can exist without Me.
explanation: Recognize the interconnectedness of all things. Nurture your ideas and efforts, as they are the seeds of future success.

sanskrit: नान्तोऽस्ति मम दिव्यानां विभूतीनां परंतप। एष तूद्देशतः प्रोक्तो विभूतेर्विस्तरो मया॥
translation: There is no end to My divine manifestations, O Arjuna. What I have spoken is but a mere glimpse of My infinite opulence.
explanation: Explore your potential and creativity, knowing that there are limitless opportunities to grow and express yourself.

sanskrit: यद्यद्विभूतिमत्सत्त्वं श्रीमदूर्जितमेव वा। तत्तदेवावगच्छ त्वं मम तेजोऽंशसम्भवम्॥
translation: Whatever is glorious, prosperous, or powerful, know that it arises from a fragment of My splendor.
explanation: Recognize and appreciate the strengths and talents in yourself and others as manifestations of a higher power. Use them wisely for greater good.

sanskrit: अथवा बहुनैतेन किं ज्ञातेन तवार्जुन। विष्टभ्याहमिदं कृत्स्नमेकांशेन स्थितो जगत्॥
translation: But what need is there for all this detailed knowledge, O Arjuna? With a single fragment of Myself, I pervade and support this entire universe.
explanation: Focus on the bigger picture. Even small efforts can have a profound impact when aligned with a greater purpose.

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | मदनुग्रहाय परमहं गूढं अध्यात्मसंञ्ज्ञितं यत् त्वयोक्तं वचस्तेन मोहोऽयं विगतो मम |
translation: Arjuna said: O Krishna, by Your grace, the supreme secret, called the science of the self, which You have spoken, has dispelled my confusion.
explanation: When you find yourself confused, seek knowledge that can enlighten you. Understanding the deeper truths, like Arjuna, can help overcome doubts and lead to clarity.

sanskrit: भवाप्ययौ हि भूतानां श्रुतौ विस्तरशो मया | तत्त्वत: कमलपत्राक्ष माहात्म्यम् अपि चाव्ययम् |
translation: I have heard in detail, O Lotus-eyed One, about the birth and dissolution of beings. I have heard of Your imperishable greatness.
explanation: Knowledge of the impermanence of life can help you focus on what truly matters. Understand the cycle of life and existence to maintain perspective during difficult times.

sanskrit: एवं एतद् यथात्थ त्वम् आत्मानं परमेश्वर | दृष्टुम् इच्छामि ते रूपम् ऐश्वरं पुरुषोत्तम |
translation: Thus, I have understood from You, the Supreme Being. Now I wish to see Your divine form, O Supreme Person.
explanation: When seeking deeper meaning or divine intervention, focus your mind on the higher purpose. Ask for clarity, as Arjuna did, to gain insight beyond the material world.

sanskrit: मनीसे यदी तत् शक्यं मया दृष्टुम् इति प्रभो | योगेश्वर ततो मे त्वं दर्शयात्मानम् अव्ययम् |
translation: O Lord, if it is possible, show me Your eternal form, as I desire to see You.
explanation: When you are unsure about the possibilities, seek guidance from those who possess the wisdom and skills to help you realize your potential.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवान उवाच | पश्य मे पार्थ रूपाणि शतशोऽथ सहस्त्रश: | नानाविधानि दिव्याणि नानावर्णाकृतिनीं च |
translation: The Blessed Lord said: O Partha, behold My divine forms, hundreds and thousands, of various kinds, divine and multicolored.
