explanation: Embrace the infinite possibilities that exist in the universe. Open your mind to new experiences and opportunities, as they can provide valuable lessons and insights.

sanskrit: पश्यादित्यां वसून् रुद्रां अश्विनौ मरुतस्तथा | बहून्य अदृष्टपूर्वाणि पश्याश्चर्याणि भारत |
translation: Behold the sun gods, the Vasus, Rudras, the twin Ashvins, and the Maruts, and many more wondrous sights, O Bharata.
explanation: Recognize the divine manifestations around you. Acknowledge the unseen forces that shape your life and be open to the marvelous things in your path.
problem_category: Recognizing the Divine in Everyday Life

sanskrit: इहैकस्थं जगत् कृत्स्नं पश्याद्य चराचरम् | मम देहे गुडाकेश यच्छान्यद् दृष्टुम् इच्छसि |
translation: Behold, O Gudakesha, the entire universe, mobile and immobile, gathered in My body. If you wish to see other things, I shall show you.
explanation: Understand that everything in the universe is interconnected. Recognize the unity within diversity and focus on the larger picture to find your way forward.

sanskrit: न तु मां शक्यसे दृष्टुम् अनेनैव स्वचक्षुषा | दिव्यं ददामि ते चक्षुः पश्य मे योगमऐश्वरम् |
translation: You cannot see Me with these eyes. I give you divine sight. Behold My divine form, O Arjuna, and see My cosmic power.
explanation: When your current perception limits your understanding, open yourself to new perspectives. Cultivate the ability to see beyond the ordinary and gain clarity.

sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच | एवम् उक्त्वा ततो राजन महायोगेश्वरो हरिः | दर्शयामासा पार्थाय परमं रूपम् ऐश्वरम् |
translation: Sanjaya said: Thus, speaking, the Supreme Lord Hari showed to Partha His supreme, divine form.
explanation: When you are ready to receive, the universe will reveal its greater truths. Be open and receptive to divine revelations when the time is right.

sanskrit: अनेकवक्त्रनयनं अनेकाद्भुतदर्शनम् | अनेकदिव्याभरणं दिव्यानेकोद्यतायुधम् |
translation: He revealed to Arjuna a form with many faces and eyes, many wondrous sights, divine ornaments, and many wielding divine weapons.
explanation: Be prepared to see things in ways you have never imagined. Life may present you with challenges or visions that are different from what you expect, but they hold great lessons.

sanskrit: दिव्यमाल्यांबरधरं दिव्यगन्धानुलेपनम् | सर्वाश्चर्यमयं देवम् अनन्तं विश्वतोमुखम् |
translation: He showed Arjuna the divine form adorned with divine garlands, smeared with divine fragrances, full of wonders, infinite, with faces and eyes all around.
explanation: When life’s challenges seem overwhelming, take a step back and view the grander picture. The universe is full of awe-inspiring wonders, and understanding this can reduce anxiety and enhance peace.

sanskrit: दिवि सूर्यसहस्त्रस्य भवेद् युगपत् उत्थिता | यदि भा: सदृशी सा स्यात् भाससस्तस्य महात्मन: |
translation: If a thousand suns were to rise at once in the sky, their radiance would resemble the splendor of that great soul.
explanation: When faced with overwhelming brilliance or challenges, realize that such experiences can be transformative. Stay grounded in your inner strength and focus, just as Arjuna did when confronted with Krishna’s divine form.

sanskrit: तत्रैकस्थं जगत् कृत्स्नं प्रविभक्तं अनेकधा | अपश्यद् देवदेवस्य शरीरें पाण्डवस्तदा |
translation: In that divine form, Arjuna saw the entire universe, divided in many ways, contained within the body of the Supreme Lord.
explanation: Life is interconnected and multifaceted. When you're feeling fragmented or disjointed, recognize that everything is part of a greater whole. Embrace the unity and flow of existence.

sanskrit: ततः स विस्मयाविष्टो हृष्टरोमा धनञ्जय: | प्रणम्य शिरसा देवं कृताञ्जलिर अभाषत |
translation: Overcome with wonder, with hairs standing on end, Dhananjaya (Arjuna) bowed down to the Lord, with folded hands, and spoke.
explanation: When you experience moments of awe or wonder, take time to pause and reflect. Such moments can inspire humility and gratitude, helping you reset and find peace amidst challenges.

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच | पश्यामि देवांश् तव देवा देहे सर्वांश् तथा भूतविशेषसंघान् | ब्रह्माणम ईशं कमलासनस्थं ऋषिंश्च सर्वान् उरगांश्च दिव्यान् |
translation: Arjuna said: O Lord, I see all the gods in Your body, along with the great rishis and divine serpents, as well as Brahma, the Creator, seated on a lotus.
explanation: When you feel connected to something greater than yourself, recognize the sacredness of all beings. By focusing on the divine within everything, you can achieve a sense of peace and unity.

sanskrit: अनेकबाहूदरवक्‍त्रनेत्रं पश्यामि त्वां सर्वतोऽनंतरूपम् | नान्तं न मध्यं न पुनस्तवादीं पश्यामि विश्वेश्वर विश्वरूप |
translation: I see You with countless arms, bellies, faces, and eyes. I see You in every direction, with no beginning, middle, or end, O Lord of the Universe, in Your universal form.
explanation: Life is full of multiple dimensions and perspectives. Try to embrace the various aspects of reality, and seek understanding beyond the boundaries of your limited perception.

sanskrit: किरिटिनं गदिनं चक्रिणं च तेजोराशिं सर्वतो दीप्तिमन्तं | पश्यामि त्वां दुरनिरीक्ष्यं समन्ताद् दीप्तानलार्कद्युतिम् अप्रमेयम् |
translation: I see You holding a crown, a mace, a discus, and radiating energy in every direction. I see You shining with the brilliance of a thousand blazing suns.
explanation: When you face challenges that seem overwhelming or difficult to comprehend, remember the immense power within you and the divine light that can illuminate even the darkest paths.

sanskrit: त्वम् अक्षरं परमं वेदितव्यं त्वम् अस्य विश्वस्य परं निधानम् | त्वम् अव्ययः शाश्वतधर्मगोप्ता सनातनस्त्वं पुरुषो मतो मे |
translation: You are the eternal, imperishable being to be realized. You are the ultimate foundation of this universe, the protector of eternal dharma, and the eternal person, O Lord.
explanation: When searching for purpose or stability, recognize the eternal truths within yourself. The foundational principles of life provide the guidance you need to navigate the complexities of existence.

sanskrit: अनादिमध्यान्तम अनन्तवीर्यम् अनन्तबाहुं शशिसूर्यनेत्रम् | पश्यामि त्वां दीप्तहुताशवक्ट्रं स्वतेजसा विश्वमिदं तपन्तम् |
translation: I see You with no beginning, middle, or end, with infinite power, many arms, and eyes like the moon and the sun. I see You glowing with a fiery aura, consuming the entire world with Your radiance.
explanation: When you feel small in the grand scheme of things, remember the infinite potential within you. Understand that your actions, when aligned with the universe, can have a profound impact.

sanskrit: द्यावापृथिव्योर इदं अन्तरं हि व्याप्तं त्वयाैकैकेन दिशश्च सर्वा: | दृष्ट्वाद्भुतं रूपम् उग्रं तवेदं लोकत्रयं प्रव्यथितं महात्मन् |
translation: This entire universe, including the heavens and the earth, is pervaded by You. Upon seeing this terrible form of Yours, all three worlds are in great distress, O Supreme Being.
explanation: When you encounter overwhelming forces, it can cause fear and discomfort. But remember that facing such forces is part of spiritual growth. Confronting them helps you overcome inner fears and grow stronger.

sanskrit: अमी हि त्वां सुरसङ्घा विशन्ति केचिद्भीताः प्राञ्जलयो गृणन्ति | स्वस्तित्युक्त्वा महर्षिसिद्धसङ्घा: स्तुवन्ति त्वां स्तुतिभि: पुष्कलाभि: |
translation: The celestial beings, seeing You, enter You in fear. Some of them, with folded hands, praise You saying ‘Peace’. The great rishis and siddhas also praise You with abundant hymns.
explanation: In moments of fear or uncertainty, take refuge in your inner strength and the support of those who have walked the path before you. Their wisdom and blessings can guide you through any challenge.
problem_category: Facing Fear with Strength and Wisdom

sanskrit: रुद्रादित्याः वसवो ये च साध्याः विश्वेश्विनौ मरुतश्चोष्मपाश्च | गन्धर्वयक्षासुरसिद्धसङ्घा विक्षन्ते त्वां विस्मिताश्चैव सर्वे |
translation: The Rudras, the Adityas, the Vasus, the Sādhyas, the Visvadevas, the Maruts, and the Gandharvas, Yaksas, Asuras, and Siddhas, all behold You, amazed.
explanation: When you experience awe, know that the entire universe recognizes your potential and the divine within you. This awareness can help you find your path and purpose in life.

sanskrit: रूपं महत्ते बहुवक्त्रनेत्रं महाबाहो बहुबाहूरुपादम्। बहूदरं बहुदंष्ट्राकरालं दृष्ट्वा लोकाः प्रव्यथितास्तथाहम्॥
translation: O mighty-armed, seeing Your vast form with many faces and eyes, arms, thighs, and feet, with many stomachs and terrifying teeth, the worlds are frightened, and so am I.
explanation: Facing immense challenges or overwhelming situations can invoke fear. Acknowledge this fear and seek strength within to confront the vastness of the unknown.

sanskrit: नभःस्पृशं दीप्तमनैकवर्णं व्यात्ताननं दीप्तविशालनेत्रम्। दृष्ट्वा हि त्वां प्रव्यथितान्तरात्मा धृतिं न विन्दामि शमं च विष्णो॥
translation: Touching the sky, glowing in many colors, with gaping mouths and large blazing eyes, seeing You, my inner self trembles, and I find neither courage nor peace, O Vishnu.
explanation: When confronted with situations that destabilize inner peace, focus on grounding yourself and seeking divine guidance to restore composure.

sanskrit: दंष्ट्राकरालानि च ते मुखानि दृष्ट्वैव कालानलसंनिभानि। दिशो न जाने न लभे च शर्म प्रसाद देवेश जगन्निवास॥
translation: Seeing Your mouths with terrifying teeth blazing like the fires of destruction, I do not know directions and find no comfort. Have mercy, O Lord of the universe.
explanation: When feeling lost and overwhelmed, appeal to a higher power or inner wisdom for clarity and comfort. Trust in the universe to guide you through uncertainty.

sanskrit: अमी च त्वां धृतराष्ट्रस्य पुत्राः सर्वे सहैवावनिपालसंघैः। भीष्मो द्रोणः सूतपुत्रस्तथासौ सहास्मदीयैरपि योधमुख्यैः॥
translation: All the sons of Dhritarashtra, along with the hosts of kings, Bhishma, Drona, and Karna, along with our chief warriors, are rushing into Your mouths.
explanation: Recognize that everyone has their destiny, and while actions are within your control, outcomes often align with a larger cosmic plan.

sanskrit: वक्त्राणि ते त्वरमाणा विशन्ति दंष्ट्राकरालानि भयंकानी। केचिद्विलग्ना दशनान्तरेषु संदृश्यन्ते चूर्णितैरुत्तमांगैः॥
translation: They rush headlong into Your terrifying mouths with dreadful teeth. Some are seen caught between Your teeth, with their heads crushed to powder.
explanation: Challenges may seem destructive and inevitable. Approach them with awareness and adaptability, knowing destruction often leads to renewal.

sanskrit: यथा नदीनां बहवोऽम्बुवेगाः समुद्रमेवाभिमुखा द्रवन्ति। तथा तवामी नरलोकवीरा विशन्ति वक्त्राण्यभिविज्वलन्ति॥
translation: As rivers flow swiftly into the ocean, so do these warriors enter Your blazing mouths.
explanation: Life's flow leads to inevitable outcomes. Embrace this flow by aligning your efforts with the larger rhythm of existence.

sanskrit: यथा प्रदीप्तं ज्वलनं पतंगा विशन्ति नाशाय समृद्धवेगाः। तथैव नाशाय विशन्ति लोकास्तवापि वक्त्राणि समृद्धवेगाः॥
translation: As moths rush with great speed into a blazing fire to their destruction, so do these beings enter Your mouths with great speed for annihilation.
explanation: Recognize the cycles of creation and destruction in life. Growth often requires letting go of outdated patterns or attachments.

sanskrit: लेलिह्यसे ग्रसमानः समन्ताल्लोकान्समग्रान्वदनैर्ज्वलद्भिः। तेजोभिरापूर्य जगत्समग्रं भासस्तवोग्राः प्रतपन्ति विष्णो॥
translation: You consume all the worlds with Your flaming mouths, filling the universe with Your radiance. Your fierce rays burn everything, O Vishnu.
explanation: The immense energy of transformation can feel consuming but is necessary for renewal. Harness this energy for positive change.

sanskrit: आख्याहि मे को भवानुग्ररूपो नमोऽस्तु ते देववर प्रसाद। विज्ञातुमिच्छामि भवन्तमाद्यं न हि प्रजानामि तव प्रवृत्तिम्॥
translation: Who are You in this fierce form? Salutations to You, O divine one. Please be gracious. I wish to understand You, the primal being, for I do not comprehend Your activity.
explanation: When faced with overwhelming phenomena, approach with humility and curiosity. Seek to understand rather than resist.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। कालोऽस्मि लोकक्षयकृत्प्रवृद्धो लोकान्समाहर्तुमिह प्रवृत्तः। ऋतेऽपि त्वां न भविष्यन्ति सर्वे येऽवस्थिताः प्रत्यनीकेषु योधाः॥
translation: The Blessed Lord said: I am Time, the destroyer of the worlds, engaged in annihilating all beings. Even without you, none of the warriors arrayed in the opposing armies shall survive.
explanation: Time is a transformative force beyond individual control. Focus on fulfilling your role rather than resisting inevitable outcomes.

sanskrit: तस्मात्त्वमुत्तिष्ठ यशो लभस्व जित्वा शत्रून्भुङ्क्ष्व राज्यं समृद्धम्। मयैवैते निहताः पूर्वमेव निमित्तमात्रं भव सव्यसाचिन्॥
translation: Therefore, arise and attain glory. Conquer your enemies and enjoy a prosperous kingdom. They have already been slain by Me; you are merely an instrument, O Arjuna.
explanation: Trust in the divine plan and take action with courage. Understand that you are an instrument in a larger purpose.

sanskrit: द्रोणं च भीष्मं च जयद्रथं च कर्णं तथान्यानपि योधवीरान्। मया हतान्त्वं जहि मा व्यथिष्ठा युध्यस्व जेतासि रणे सपत्नान्॥
translation: Drona, Bhishma, Jayadratha, Karna, and other brave warriors have already been slain by Me. Do not fear; fight, and you shall conquer your enemies in battle.
explanation: Fear often paralyzes action. Recognize that challenges may already have their solutions. Focus on performing your duties courageously, trusting the divine plan.

sanskrit: सञ्जय उवाच। एतच्छ्रुत्वा वचनं केशवस्य कृताञ्जलिर्वेपमानः किरीटी। नमस्कृत्वा भूय एवाह कृष्णं सगद्गदं भीतभीतः प्रणम्य॥
translation: Sanjaya said: Hearing these words of Krishna, Arjuna, trembling and with folded hands, bowed down again, and in a choked voice, full of fear, spoke to Krishna.
explanation: In moments of fear and humility, turning to a trusted guide or higher power can bring solace and clarity. Bowing to wisdom helps overcome emotional turmoil.

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। स्थानॆ हृषीकेश तव प्रकीर्त्या जगत्प्रहृष्यत्यनुरज्यतॆ च। रक्षांसि भीतानि दिशो द्रवन्ति सर्वे नमस्यन्ति च सिद्धसंघाः॥
translation: Arjuna said: O Hrishikesha, rightly does the world rejoice and delight in Your praise. The demons flee in fear in all directions, and the hosts of sages bow to You.
explanation: The power of righteousness and truth naturally inspires joy and reverence while instilling fear in negativity. Speak and act in alignment with your values to attract positive energies.

sanskrit: कस्माच्च ते न नमेरन्महात्मन् गरीयसे ब्रह्मणोऽप्यादिकर्त्रे। अनन्त देवेश जगन्निवास त्वमक्षरं सदसत्तत्परं यत्॥
translation: Why should they not bow to You, O Supreme One? You are greater than even Brahma, the original Creator. Infinite Lord of the gods, abode of the universe, You are imperishable, beyond both existence and non-existence.
explanation: Recognizing the grandeur of the universe helps put personal struggles into perspective. Cultivate humility and gratitude to align with greater forces of life.

sanskrit: त्वमादिदेवः पुरुषः पुराणस्त्वमस्य विश्वस्य परं निधािनम्। वेत्तासि वेद्यं च परं च धाम त्वया ततं विश्वमनन्तरूप॥
translation: You are the Primal God, the Ancient Person, the ultimate resting place of this universe. You are the knower and the knowable, the supreme abode; by You is the universe pervaded in infinite forms.
explanation: Understanding the interconnectedness of all things helps to foster a sense of belonging and purpose. Reflect on your role in the larger scheme of existence.

sanskrit: वायुर्यमोग्निर्वरुणः शशाङ्कः प्रजापतिस्त्वं प्रपितामहश्च। नमो नमस्तेऽस्तु सहस्रकृत्वः पुनश्च भूयोऽपि नमो नमस्ते॥
translation: You are Vayu, Yama, Agni, Varuna, the moon, the Creator, and the great-grandfather. Obeisance to You a thousand times, and again and again salutations to You.
explanation: Recognizing divinity in various forms helps cultivate reverence for diversity and unity in life. Appreciate the manifold expressions of the divine in everyday experiences.

sanskrit: नमः पुरस्तादथ पृष्ठतस्ते नमोऽस्तु ते सर्वत एव सर्व। अनन्तवीर्यामितविक्रमस्त्वं सर्वं समाप्नोषि ततोऽसि सर्वः॥
translation: Salutations to You from the front and the back! O all-pervading One, infinite in power and boundless in might, You encompass everything and therefore You are everything.
explanation: Acknowledging the omnipresence of divinity can help in overcoming the illusion of separation. Approach all aspects of life with respect and inclusivity.

sanskrit: सखॆति मत्वा प्रसभं यदुक्तं हॆ कृष्ण हॆ यादव हॆ सखॆति। अजानता महिमानं तवॆदं मया प्रमादात्प्रणयॆन वापि॥
translation: Considering You merely a friend, I rashly addressed You as 'Krishna,' 'Yadava,' or 'friend,' unaware of Your greatness, out of negligence or affection.
explanation: Sometimes, familiarity leads to underestimating the significance of people or situations. Reflect on and correct such moments with humility and reverence.

sanskrit: यच्चावहासार्थमसत्कृतोऽसि विहारशय्यासनभोजनेषु। एकोऽथवाप्यच्युत तत्समक्षं तत्क्षामये त्वामहमप्रमेयम्॥
translation: For whatever disrespect I may have shown You in jest, while resting, sitting, or eating, alone or in the presence of others, I seek Your forgiveness, O Incomprehensible One.
explanation: Acknowledge and apologize for unintended disrespect. This fosters better relationships and cultivates personal growth through humility.

sanskrit: पितासि लोकस्य चराचरस्य त्वमस्य पूज्यश्च गुरर्गरीयान्। न त्वत्समोऽस्त्यभ्यधिकः कुतोऽन्यो लोकत्रयेऽप्यप्रतिमप्रभाव॥
translation: You are the Father of the entire universe, of the moving and the unmoving. You are the most worthy of worship, the greatest teacher. None is equal to You in the three worlds; who then could surpass You?
explanation: Acknowledging the profound influence of mentors and guides in life fosters gratitude and deeper understanding. Value their wisdom and learn from their guidance.

sanskrit: तस्मात्प्रणम्य प्रणिधाय कायं प्रसादये त्वामहमीड्यमीशम्। पितेव पुत्रस्य सखेव सख्युः प्रियः प्रियायार्हसि देव सोढुम्॥
translation: Therefore, bowing down and prostrating my body, I seek Your grace, O adorable Lord. You, the master of all, are to be endured like a father with a son or a friend with a friend or a lover with a beloved.
explanation: Approach relationships with humility and mutual respect, understanding the bond of love and forgiveness that exists between close companions.

sanskrit: अदृष्टपूर्वं हृषितोऽस्मि दृष्ट्वा भयेन च प्रव्यथितं मनो मे। तदेव मे दर्शय देव रूपं प्रसीद देवेश जगन्निवास॥
translation: Having seen this form never seen before, I am filled with joy, yet my mind is also perturbed with fear. O Lord of gods, O refuge of the universe, please show me Your form as the serene Lord.
explanation: When facing overwhelming new experiences, it’s essential to balance excitement with a sense of grounding. Seek familiar elements or structures to restore calm and focus.

sanskrit: किरीटिनं गदिनं चक्रहस्तं इच्छामि त्वां दृष्टुमहं तथैव। तेनैव रूपेण चतुर्भुजेन सहस्रबाहो भव विश्वमूर्ते॥
translation: I wish to see You as before, crowned, holding a mace and discus in hand, in Your four-armed form. O thousand-armed universal form, appear as Your serene self.
explanation: In moments of disorientation, reverting to a familiar and trusted perspective can provide comfort and clarity, enabling effective decision-making.

sanskrit: मया प्रसन्नेन तवार्जुनेदं रूपं परं दर्शितमात्मयोगात्। तेजोमयं विश्वमनन्तमाद्यं यन्मे त्वदन्येन न दृष्टपूर्वम्॥
translation: Out of My grace, O Arjuna, I have shown you this supreme form by My divine power. This form, radiant, infinite, and primal, has never been seen by anyone other than you.
explanation: Recognize and cherish unique insights or opportunities that come your way as a privilege and use them for your growth and understanding.

sanskrit: न वेद यज्ञाध्ययनैर् न दानैः न च क्रियाभिर् न तपोभिरुग्रैः। एवंरूपः शक्य अहं नृलोके दृष्टुं त्वदन्येन कुरुप्रवीर॥
translation: Neither through the Vedas, sacrifices, charity, nor austere practices can one see this form of Mine, which you have seen, O best among the Kurus.
explanation: Some truths or experiences are beyond conventional efforts. Embrace faith and grace in addition to hard work to achieve deeper understanding.

sanskrit: मा ते व्यथा मा च विमूढभावो दृष्ट्वा रूपं घोरमीदृङ्ममेदम्। व्यपेतभीः प्रीतमनाः पुनस्त्वं तदेव मे रूपमिदं प्रपश्य॥
translation: Let there be no fear or confusion upon seeing this dreadful form of Mine. Be free from fear and with a joyful heart, behold My form as it was before.
explanation: When intimidated by a challenge, shift focus to its manageable aspects. Cultivating calm and joy helps restore perspective and confidence.

sanskrit: इत्यर्जुनं वासुदेवस्तथोक्त्वा स्वकं रूपं दर्शयामास भूयः। आश्वासयामास च भीतमेनं भूत्वा पुनः सौम्यवपुर् महात्मा॥
translation: Having spoken thus to Arjuna, Vasudeva revealed His original, gentle form and comforted the fearful Arjuna, assuming His serene appearance once again.
explanation: Reassuring others during difficult times with empathy and gentleness fosters trust and helps them regain composure and strength.

sanskrit: दृष्ट्वेदं मानुषं रूपं तव सौम्यं जनार्दन। इदानीमस्मि संवृत्तः सचेता: प्रकृतिं गतः॥
translation: Having seen Your gentle, human form, O Janardana, I am now composed and restored to my natural state of mind.
explanation: Calm and familiar environments help regain mental clarity and focus, especially after periods of emotional turmoil.

sanskrit: सुदुर्दर्शम् इदं रूपं दृष्टवानसि यन्मम। देवा अप्यस्य रूपस्य नित्यं दर्शनकाङ्क्षिणः॥
translation: This form of Mine that you have seen is very difficult to behold. Even the gods are always eager to see it.
explanation: Cherish rare experiences as valuable milestones in your journey, recognizing their uniqueness and transformative potential.

sanskrit: नाहं वेदैर्न तपसा न दानेन न चेज्यया। शक्य एवंविधो दृष्टुं दृष्टवानसि मां यथा॥
translation: Not through the Vedas, penance, charity, or rituals can I be seen in this form as you have seen Me.
explanation: Realization often transcends traditional means. Embrace holistic approaches, including devotion and grace, to achieve the extraordinary.

sanskrit: भक्त्या त्वनन्यया शक्य अहमेवंविधोऽर्जुन। ज्ञातुं द्रष्टुं च तत्त्वेन प्रवेष्टुं च परंतप॥
translation: But by undivided devotion, O Arjuna, I can be known, seen, and entered into, in truth, O scorcher of foes.
explanation: Unwavering dedication and focus lead to deeper understanding and closer connections with one’s goals or purpose.

sanskrit: मत्कर्मकृन्मत्परमो मद्भक्तः सङ्गवर्जितः। निर्वैरः सर्वभूतेषु यः स मामेति पाण्डव॥
translation: He who performs all actions for Me, who considers Me the supreme goal, is devoted to Me, free from attachment, and without enmity towards any being—he attains Me, O Pandava.
explanation: Aligning actions with higher purpose, cultivating devotion, and letting go of negativity foster a fulfilling and goal-oriented life.

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। एवं सततयुक्ता ये भक्तास्त्वां पर्युपासते। ये चाप्यक्षरमव्यक्तं तेषां के योगवित्तमाः॥
translation: Arjuna said: Those devotees who are ever steadfast, worshiping You with devotion, and those who worship the imperishable and unmanifest—which of them are better versed in yoga?
explanation: When faced with multiple approaches to achieve a goal, assess their effectiveness based on alignment with your abilities and values. Both paths may lead to success, but clarity on your nature simplifies the choice.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। मय्यावेश्य मनो ये मां नित्ययुक्ता उपासते। श्रद्धया परयोपेतास्ते मे युक्ततमा मताः॥
translation: The Blessed Lord said: Those who fix their minds on Me and worship Me with supreme faith, ever steadfast, I consider them to be the most perfect in yoga.
explanation: Focused devotion and consistency are key to mastering any discipline. Prioritize your energies on a single goal with faith and dedication to excel.

sanskrit: ये त्वक्षरमनिर्देश्यमव्यक्तं पर्युपासते। सर्वत्रगमचिन्त्यं च कूटस्थमचलं ध्रुवम्॥
translation: But those who worship the imperishable, indefinable, unmanifest, all-pervading, incomprehensible, unchanging, immovable, and eternal...
explanation: Understanding abstract goals requires patience and intellectual effort. Engage deeply and systematically to grasp such profound concepts.

sanskrit: संनियम्येन्द्रियग्रामं सर्वत्र समबुद्धयः। ते प्राप्नुवन्ति मामेव सर्वभूतहिते रताः॥
translation: Having restrained their senses, with an even mind toward all, and engaged in the welfare of all beings, they too attain Me.
explanation: Self-discipline and an impartial mindset help in achieving harmony and universal well-being. Foster inclusivity and control impulses to progress meaningfully.

sanskrit: क्लेशोऽधिकतरस्तेषामव्यक्तासक्तचेतसाम्। अव्यक्ता हि गतिर्दुःखं देहवद्भिरवाप्यते॥
translation: The effort is greater for those whose minds are attached to the unmanifest, for the goal of the unmanifest is difficult to attain for embodied beings.
explanation: Complex or abstract pursuits often require higher effort and resilience. Choose simpler, tangible approaches if they align better with your current capacity.

sanskrit: ये तु सर्वाणि कर्माणि मयि संन्यस्य मत्परः। अनन्येनैव योगेन मां ध्यायन्त उपासते॥
translation: But those who surrender all actions to Me, regarding Me as the Supreme, worship Me and meditate on Me with undivided devotion...
explanation: Surrendering outcomes to a higher purpose while staying focused on your efforts reduces stress and enhances commitment.

sanskrit: तेषामहं समुद्धर्ता मृत्युसंसारसागरात्। भवामि न चिरात्पार्थ मय्यावेशितचेतसाम्॥
translation: For those whose minds are fixed on Me, O Partha, I swiftly rescue them from the ocean of birth and death.
explanation: Anchoring yourself in a higher purpose provides strength to overcome life's challenges and uncertainties.

sanskrit: मय्येव मन आधत्स्व मयि बुद्धिं निवेशय। निवसिष्यसि मय्येव अत ऊर्ध्वं न संशयः॥
translation: Fix your mind on Me and establish your intellect in Me; thereupon, you will live in Me without doubt.
explanation: Aligning thoughts and intellect with a singular purpose ensures long-term success and clarity of vision.

sanskrit: अथ चित्तं समाधातुं न शक्नोषि मयि स्थिरम्। अभ्यासयोगेन ततो मामिच्छाप्तुं धनञ्जय॥
translation: If you are unable to fix your mind steadily on Me, then seek to reach Me by the practice of discipline, O Dhananjaya.
explanation: If direct mastery is difficult, break it into smaller, manageable steps. Regular practice leads to gradual improvement.

sanskrit: अभ्यासेऽप्यसमर्थोऽसि मत्कर्मपरमो भव। मदर्थमपि कर्माणि कुर्वन् सिद्धिमवाप्स्यसि॥
translation: If you are unable even to practice, then be intent on actions for My sake; by doing actions for Me, you shall attain perfection.
explanation: When higher goals seem unreachable, focus on consistent action, knowing that steady effort leads to growth and success.

sanskrit: अथैतदप्यशक्तोऽसि कर्तुं मद्योगमाश्रितः। सर्वकर्मफलत्यागं ततः कुरु यतात्मवान्॥
translation: If you are unable to do even this, then taking refuge in Me, abandon the fruits of all actions with self-control.
explanation: When it's difficult to act perfectly, surrender the desire for results and focus on your efforts. This reduces anxiety and keeps you grounded.

sanskrit: श्रेयो हि ज्ञानमभ्यासाज्ज्ञानाद्ध्यानं विशिष्यते। ध्यानात्कर्मफलत्यागस्त्यागाच्छान्तिरनन्तरम्॥
translation: Knowledge is superior to mere practice; meditation surpasses knowledge; renunciation of the fruits of actions is superior to meditation, for peace follows renunciation.
explanation: Prioritize steps based on your capacity. Begin with knowledge, evolve to meditation, and ultimately embrace detachment for lasting peace.

sanskrit: अद्वेष्टा सर्वभूतानां मैत्रः करुण एव च। निर्ममो निरहंकारः समदुःखसुखः क्षमी॥
translation: One who is free from malice toward all beings, friendly and compassionate, free from attachment and ego, even-minded in pleasure and pain, and forgiving...
explanation: Cultivating kindness and letting go of ego fosters harmonious relationships and emotional resilience.

sanskrit: सन्तुष्टः सततं योगी यतात्मा दृढनिश्चयः। मय्यर्पितमनोबुद्धिर्यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः॥
translation: Ever content, self-controlled, firm in resolve, with mind and intellect dedicated to Me—such a devotee is dear to Me.
explanation: Stay content, disciplined, and dedicated to your goals to cultivate inner strength and earn respect.

sanskrit: यस्मान्नोद्विजते लोको लोकान्नोद्विजते च यः। हर्षामर्षभयोद्वेगैर्मुक्तो यः स च मे प्रियः॥
translation: One who neither agitates the world nor is agitated by it, who is free from joy, envy, fear, and anxiety, is dear to Me.
explanation: Practice emotional stability and avoid being reactive to maintain balance and earn trust.

sanskrit: अनपेक्षः शुचिर्दक्ष उदासीनो गतव्यथः। सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी यो मद्भक्तः स मे प्रियः॥
translation: Free from expectations, pure, skilled, impartial, free from distress, renouncing all undertakings—such a devotee is dear to Me.
explanation: Releasing expectations and focusing on purity and skillful action enhances peace and productivity.

sanskrit: यो न हृष्यति न द्वेष्टि न शोचति न काङ्क्षति। शुभाशुभपरित्यागी भक्तिमान्यः स मे प्रियः॥
translation: One who neither rejoices nor resents, neither grieves nor desires, renouncing both good and evil actions—such a devotee is dear to Me.
explanation: Detach from extremes of emotions and outcomes to remain balanced and centered.

sanskrit: समः शत्रौ च मित्रे च तथा मानापमानयोः। शीतोष्णसुखदुःखेषु समः सङ्गविवर्जितः॥
translation: Equal toward friend and foe, in honor and dishonor, in heat and cold, pleasure and pain, free from attachment...
explanation: Maintain equanimity in relationships and circumstances to navigate challenges effectively.

sanskrit: तुल्यनिन्दास्तुतिर्मौनी सन्तुष्टो येन केनचित्। अनिकेतः स्थिरमतिर्भक्तिमान्मे प्रियो नरः॥
translation: One who is indifferent to praise and blame, silent, content with anything, without attachment to a home, firm in mind, and devoted to Me is dear to Me.
explanation: Being content and unaffected by external opinions fosters inner peace and self-reliance.

sanskrit: ये तु धर्म्यामृतमिदं यथोक्तं पर्युपासते। श्रद्धधाना मत्परामाः भक्तास्तेऽतीव मे प्रियाः॥
translation: Those who follow this nectar of dharma, as described, with faith and regard Me as supreme—such devotees are exceedingly dear to Me.
explanation: Following ethical principles with faith and dedication ensures long-term success and fulfillment.

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव क्षेत्रं क्षेत्रज्ञमेव च। एतद्वेदितुमिच्छामि ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं च केशव॥
translation: Arjuna said: I desire to know about Nature and Spirit, the Field and the Knower of the Field, as well as knowledge and the object of knowledge, O Keshava.
explanation: To gain clarity in life, ask fundamental questions about the nature of existence, the self, and the world around you. Curiosity leads to wisdom.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। इदं शरीरं कौन्तेय क्षेत्रमित्यभिधीयते। एतद्यो वेत्ति तं प्राहुः क्षेत्रज्ञ इति तद्विदः॥
translation: The Blessed Lord said: This body, O Kaunteya, is called the Field, and one who knows this Field is called the Knower of the Field by the wise.
explanation: Understand that your body is merely a field of experience, and your true self is the observer. This perspective helps detach from physical limitations.

sanskrit: क्षेत्रज्ञं चापि मां विद्धि सर्वक्षेत्रेषु भारत। क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोर्ज्ञानं यत्तज्ज्ञानं मतं मम॥
translation: Know Me also as the Knower of the Field in all Fields, O Bharata. The knowledge of the Field and the Knower of the Field is true knowledge in My view.
explanation: Recognize the universal presence of the divine in all beings. This fosters unity and humility.

sanskrit: तत्क्षेत्रं यच्च यादृक्च यद्विकारि यतश्च यत्। स च यो यत्प्रभावश्च तत्समासेन मे श्रृणु॥
translation: What the Field is, what it is like, what its transformations are, from where it originates, and who He is, listen to this briefly from Me.
explanation: Explore the origins and dynamics of the world to understand the forces shaping your experiences and choices.

sanskrit: ऋषिभिर्बहुधा गीतं छन्दोभिर्विविधैः पृथक्। ब्रह्मसूत्रपदैश्चैव हेतुमद्भिर्विनिश्चितैः॥
translation: The Field and its knowledge have been sung by sages in many ways, in various Vedic hymns, and also described in the rational and decisive verses of the Brahmasutras.
explanation: Seek wisdom from diverse and authoritative sources to gain a well-rounded understanding of life’s complexities.

sanskrit: महाभूतान्यहंकारो बुद्धिरव्यक्तमेव च। इन्द्रियाणि दशैकं च पञ्च चेन्द्रियगोचराः॥
translation: The great elements, ego, intellect, and also the unmanifest; the ten senses, the mind, and the five objects of the senses...
explanation: Recognize the components of existence, from physical elements to mental faculties, to manage life holistically.

sanskrit: इच्छा द्वेषः सुखं दुःखं सङ्घातश्चेतना धृतिः। एतत्क्षेत्रं समासेन सविकारमुदाहृतम्॥
translation: Desire, aversion, pleasure, pain, the body, consciousness, and will—all these are briefly described as the Field and its modifications.
explanation: Identify and understand your desires, emotions, and motivations to guide your actions wisely.

sanskrit: अमानित्वमदम्भित्वमहिंसा क्षान्तिरार्जवम्। आचार्योपासनं शौचं स्थैर्यमात्मविनिग्रहः॥
translation: Humility, modesty, non-violence, forgiveness, uprightness, service to the teacher, purity, steadfastness, and self-control...
explanation: Cultivate virtues like humility and self-discipline to build a strong and positive character.

sanskrit: इन्द्रियार्थेषु वैराग्यमनहंकार एव च। जन्ममृत्युजराव्याधिदुःखदोषानुदर्शनम्॥
translation: Detachment toward sense objects, absence of ego, and constant contemplation of the evils of birth, death, old age, disease, and sorrow...
explanation: Develop detachment from material desires and ego by reflecting on life’s transient nature.

sanskrit: असक्तिरनभिष्वङ्गः पुत्रदारगृहादिषु। नित्यं च समचित्तत्वमिष्टानिष्टोपपत्तिषु॥
translation: Non-attachment and freedom from excessive affection toward children, spouse, and home, along with constant equanimity in the face of the desirable and undesirable...
explanation: Balance relationships and stay composed in fluctuating circumstances to achieve peace.

sanskrit: मयि चानन्ययोगेन भक्तिरव्यभिचारिणी। विविक्तदेशसेवित्वमरतिर्जनसंसदि॥
translation: Unswerving devotion to Me with exclusive focus, preference for solitude, and distaste for social gatherings...
explanation: Dedicate time to spiritual practices and solitude for deeper self-realization.

sanskrit: अध्यात्मज्ञाननित्यत्वं तत्त्वज्ञानार्थदर्शनम्। एतज्ज्ञानमिति प्रोक्तमज्ञानं यदतोऽन्यथा॥
translation: Perpetual focus on self-knowledge, contemplation of the truth—this is declared to be knowledge, and that which is otherwise is ignorance.
explanation: Pursue self-awareness and truth to discern knowledge from ignorance and align with wisdom.

sanskrit: ज्ञेयं यत्तत्प्रवक्ष्यामि यज्ज्ञात्वामृतमश्नुते। अनादिमत्परं ब्रह्म न सत्तन्नासदुच्यते॥
translation: I will explain that which is to be known, knowing which one attains immortality. It is the beginningless Supreme Brahman, which is neither existence nor non-existence.
explanation: Understand the eternal essence (Brahman) that transcends dualities like existence and non-existence. This helps in overcoming fear of mortality and finding peace in the eternal truth.

sanskrit: सर्वतः पाणिपादं तत्सर्वतोऽक्षिशिरोमुखम्। सर्वतः श्रुतिमल्लोके सर्वमावृत्य तिष्ठति॥
translation: With hands and feet everywhere, with eyes, heads, and mouths everywhere, with ears everywhere, it exists, pervading everything in the universe.
explanation: Recognize the omnipresence of the divine in all beings and situations. This fosters a sense of universal connection and reverence.

sanskrit: सर्वेन्द्रियगुणाभासं सर्वेन्द्रियविवर्जितम्। असक्तं सर्वभृच्चैव निर्गुणं गुणभोक्तृ च॥
translation: Though perceiving all sense objects, it is devoid of the senses. Though unattached, it sustains everything. Though transcendent of the qualities, it is the experiencer of qualities.
explanation: Detach from sensory indulgence while acknowledging your role in the world. Balance detachment with engagement for harmony.

sanskrit: बहिरन्तश्च भूतानामचरं चरमेव च। सूक्ष्मत्वात्तदविज्ञेयं दूरस्थं चान्तिके च तत्॥
translation: It exists outside and inside all beings, as the unmoving and the moving. It is so subtle that it is incomprehensible. It is far and yet near.
explanation: Accept the paradoxical nature of the divine—it is both transcendent and immanent. This perspective enhances spiritual understanding.

sanskrit: अविभक्तं च भूतेषु विभक्तमिव च स्थितम्। भूतभर्तृ च तज्ज्ञेयं ग्रसिष्णु प्रभविष्णु च॥
translation: Though undivided, it appears divided among beings. Know it as the sustainer of beings, as well as the devourer and originator.
explanation: Understand the unifying force that sustains all life. This fosters a sense of interconnectedness and respect for all existence.

sanskrit: ज्योतिषामपि तज्ज्योतिस्तमसः परमुच्यते। ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं ज्ञानगम्यं हृदि सर्वस्य विष्ठितम्॥
translation: It is the light of lights and is beyond darkness. It is knowledge, the object of knowledge, and attainable through knowledge, residing in the hearts of all.
explanation: Seek inner enlightenment by recognizing the divine light within, which dispels ignorance and leads to wisdom.

sanskrit: इति क्षेत्रं तथा ज्ञानं ज्ञेयं चोक्तं समासतः। मद्भक्त एतद्विज्ञाय मद्भावायोपपद्यते॥
translation: Thus, the Field, knowledge, and the object of knowledge have been briefly described. By understanding this, My devotee attains My nature.
explanation: Integrate knowledge and devotion to align yourself with the divine essence, leading to liberation.

sanskrit: प्रकृतिं पुरुषं चैव विद्ध्यनादी उभावपि। विकारांश्च गुणांश्चैव विद्धि प्रकृतिसंभवान्॥
translation: Know that both Nature and Spirit are without beginning, and know also that all modifications and qualities arise from Nature.
explanation: Understand the interplay of Nature and Spirit to navigate life's changes with composure.

sanskrit: कार्यकारणकर्तृत्वे हेतुः प्रकृतिरुच्यते। पुरुषः सुखदुःखानां भोक्तृत्वे हेतुरुच्यते॥
translation: Nature is said to be the cause of the functions of the body and senses, while Spirit is said to be the cause of the experience of pleasure and pain.
explanation: Differentiate between the roles of body and consciousness to manage emotions and actions effectively.

sanskrit: पुरुषः प्रकृतिस्थो हि भुङ्क्ते प्रकृतिजान्गुणान्। कारणं गुणसङ्गोऽस्य सदसद्योनिजन्मसु॥
translation: Spirit, seated in Nature, experiences the qualities of Nature. Attachment to these qualities is the cause of births in good and evil wombs.
explanation: Avoid attachment to material qualities to break free from the cycle of birth and rebirth.

sanskrit: उपद्रष्टानुमन्ता च भर्ता भोक्ता महेश्वरः। परमात्मेति चाप्युक्तो देहेऽस्मिन्पुरुषः परः॥
translation: The Supreme Spirit in the body is also called the Witness, the Permitter, the Supporter, the Enjoyer, the Great Lord, and the Supreme Self.
explanation: Acknowledge the Supreme Self within as a guide and witness, empowering you to make wise and ethical choices.

sanskrit: य एवं वेत्ति पुरुषं प्रकृतिं च गुणैः सह। सर्वथा वर्तमानोऽपि न स भूयोऽभिजायते॥
translation: He who understands Spirit, Nature, and the qualities is not born again, regardless of his way of life.
explanation: Comprehend the essence of Nature and Spirit to achieve liberation from the cycle of birth and death.

sanskrit: ध्यानेनात्मनि पश्यन्ति केचिदात्मानमात्मना। अन्ये सांख्येन योगेन कर्मयोगेन चापरे॥
translation: Some perceive the Self within themselves through meditation, others through the path of knowledge, and yet others through selfless action.
explanation: Choose a path—meditation, knowledge, or selfless action—that resonates with you to discover your true self and attain peace.

sanskrit: अन्ये त्वेवमजानन्तः श्रुत्वान्येभ्य उपासते। तेऽपि चातितरन्त्येव मृत्युं श्रुतिपरायणाः॥
translation: Even those who are unaware of these paths, but hear from others and worship with faith, also transcend death by adhering to what they hear.
explanation: Faith and devotion can guide even those without deep understanding. Trust in higher wisdom can lead to liberation.

sanskrit: यावत्संजायते किञ्चित्सत्त्वं स्थावरजङ्गमम्। क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञसंयोगात्तद्विद्धि भरतर्षभ॥
translation: Whatever comes into existence—whether moving or unmoving—know it arises from the union of the Field and the Knower of the Field.
explanation: Recognize the interplay between the physical and the conscious in all creation. This understanding fosters a holistic view of life.

sanskrit: समं सर्वेषु भूतेषु तिष्ठन्तं परमेश्वरम्। विनश्यत्स्वविनश्यन्तं यः पश्यति स पश्यति॥
translation: He truly sees who sees the Supreme Lord equally present in all beings, the unchanging amidst the perishable.
explanation: Cultivate the vision to see the divine equally in all beings, transcending biases and fostering unity.

sanskrit: समं पश्यन्हि सर्वत्र समवस्थितमीश्वरम्। न हिनस्त्यात्मनात्मानं ततो याति परां गतिम्॥
translation: Seeing the Lord equally in all, one does not degrade oneself by harming others and thus attains the supreme state.
explanation: Avoid harming others by recognizing the interconnectedness of all life, leading to personal and spiritual upliftment.

sanskrit: प्रकृत्यैव च कर्माणि क्रियमाणानि सर्वशः। यः पश्यति तथात्मानमकर्तारं स पश्यति॥
translation: He who sees actions as performed by Nature alone, and the Self as non-doer, truly sees.
explanation: Detach from the sense of doership by understanding that Nature performs actions. This reduces stress and fosters inner peace.

sanskrit: यदा भूतपृथग्भावमेकस्थमनुपश्यति। ततो एव च विस्तारं ब्रह्म संपद्यते तदा॥
translation: When one perceives the diversity of beings as rooted in one, and their expansion from it, one attains Brahman.
explanation: See unity in diversity to align with the divine essence, leading to spiritual realization.

sanskrit: अनादित्वान्निर्गुणत्वात्परमात्मायमव्ययः। शरीरस्थोऽपि कौन्तेय न करोति न लिप्यते॥
translation: Being beginningless and without qualities, the Supreme Self is imperishable. Though residing in the body, it neither acts nor is tainted.
explanation: Understand the Self as pure and unaffected by worldly actions, which fosters inner strength and purity.

sanskrit: यथा सर्वगतं सौक्ष्म्यादाकाशं नोपलिप्यते। सर्वत्रावस्थितो देहे तथात्मा नोपलिप्यते॥
translation: As the all-pervading space is not tainted because of its subtlety, so the Self, present everywhere in the body, is not tainted.
explanation: Realize that the true Self remains pure and untouched by external events, helping to maintain equanimity.

sanskrit: यथा प्रकाशयत्येकः कृत्स्नं लोकमिमं रविः। क्षेत्रं क्षेत्री तथा कृत्स्नं प्रकाशयति भारत॥
translation: As one sun illuminates the entire world, so does the Knower of the Field illuminate the whole Field, O Arjuna.
explanation: Cultivate awareness that your consciousness lights up all experiences, promoting self-awareness and mindfulness.

sanskrit: क्षेत्रक्षेत्रज्ञयोरेवमन्तरं ज्ञानचक्षुषा। भूतप्रकृतिमोक्षं च ये विदुर्यान्ति ते परम्॥
translation: Those who, through the eyes of wisdom, perceive the distinction between the Field and the Knower of the Field, and the liberation from the Nature of being, attain the Supreme.
explanation: Gain wisdom to differentiate between the transient and the eternal to achieve liberation and ultimate peace.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। परं भूयः प्रवक्ष्यामि ज्ञानानां ज्ञानमुत्तमम्। यज्ज्ञात्वा मुनयः सर्वे परां सिद्धिमितो गताः॥
translation: The Blessed Lord said: I shall now explain again the supreme wisdom, the best of all knowledge, by knowing which all sages have attained the highest perfection.
explanation: True wisdom leads to perfection and peace. Strive to acquire the highest knowledge to achieve self-realization.

sanskrit: इदं ज्ञानमुपाश्रित्य मम साधर्म्यमागताः। सर्गेऽपि नोपजायन्ते प्रलये न व्यथन्ति च॥
translation: By taking refuge in this knowledge, one attains my nature. Such beings are neither born at creation nor disturbed at dissolution.
explanation: Attaining divine knowledge ensures freedom from the cycles of birth and death, fostering eternal peace.

sanskrit: मम योनिर्महद्ब्रह्म तस्मिन्गर्भं दधाम्यहम्। संभवः सर्वभूतानां ततः भवति भारत॥
translation: My womb is the great Brahman; in that I place the seed, and from it, O Arjuna, comes the birth of all beings.
explanation: Understand the divine source of creation. Recognizing the universal origin helps cultivate humility and gratitude.

sanskrit: सर्वयोनिषु कौन्तेय मूर्तयः संभवन्ति याः। तासां ब्रह्म महद्योनिरहं बीजप्रदः पिता॥
translation: Whatever forms are born in all species, O Arjuna, the great Brahman is their womb, and I am the seed-giving father.
explanation: Appreciate the interconnectedness of all life forms, which fosters respect for diversity and unity.

sanskrit: सत्त्वं रजस्तम इति गुणाः प्रकृतिसंभवाः। निबध्नन्ति महाबाहो देहे देहिनमव्ययम्॥
translation: Sattva, rajas, and tamas—these qualities born of Nature bind the imperishable soul to the body, O mighty-armed Arjuna.
explanation: Recognize the influence of the three modes of nature (qualities) and learn to transcend them for spiritual freedom.

sanskrit: तत्र सत्त्वं निर्मलत्वात्प्रकाशकमनामयम्। सुखसङ्गेन बध्नाति ज्ञानसङ्गेन चानघ॥
translation: Of these, Sattva, being pure, is illuminating and free from sorrow. It binds by attachment to happiness and knowledge, O sinless one.
explanation: Cultivate Sattva for clarity and happiness, but also avoid becoming attached to it for true liberation.

sanskrit: रजो रागात्मकं विद्धि तृष्णासङ्गसमुद्भवम्। तन्निबध्नाति कौन्तेय कर्मसङ्गेन देहिनम्॥
translation: Know rajas to be of the nature of passion, arising from desire and attachment. It binds the embodied being by attachment to action, O son of Kunti.
explanation: Avoid being driven solely by desires and attachment to action, which lead to restlessness and stress.

sanskrit: तमस्त्वज्ञानजं विद्धि मोहनं सर्वदेहिनाम्। प्रमादालस्यनिद्राभिस्तन्निबध्नाति भारत॥
translation: And know tamas, born of ignorance, as deluding all embodied beings. It binds through carelessness, laziness, and sleep, O Arjuna.
explanation: Guard against ignorance and lethargy, as they hinder progress and trap one in inertia.

sanskrit: सत्त्वं सुखे संजायति रजः कर्मणि भारत। ज्ञानमावृत्य तु तमः प्रमादे संजयत्युत॥
translation: Sattva binds to happiness, rajas to action, and tamas, veiling knowledge, binds to carelessness, O Arjuna.
explanation: Balance is key. While Sattva promotes happiness, transcend all qualities to achieve ultimate freedom.

sanskrit: रजस्तमश्चाभिभूय सत्त्वं भवति भारत। रजः सत्त्वं तमश्चैव तमः सत्त्वं रजस्तथा॥
translation: Sometimes sattva prevails, overpowering rajas and tamas; at other times, rajas or tamas prevails over the other two, O Arjuna.
explanation: Recognize the shifting dominance of these qualities and strive to remain detached, maintaining equilibrium.

sanskrit: सर्वद्वारेषु देहेऽस्मिन्प्रकाश उपजायते। ज्ञानं यदा तदा विद्यात्विवृद्धं सत्त्वमित्युत॥
translation: When all the doors of the body are illuminated by knowledge, it should be understood that sattva is predominant.
explanation: When clarity and lightness fill your life, it indicates a dominance of positive energy (sattva). Nurture this by seeking knowledge, practicing mindfulness, and engaging in virtuous actions.

sanskrit: लोभः प्रवृत्तिरारम्भः कर्मणामशमः स्पृहा। रजस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे भरतर्षभ॥
translation: Greed, activity, the undertaking of actions, restlessness, and longing arise when rajas is predominant, O best of the Bharatas.
explanation: Recognize when restlessness or greed drives you. Balance these tendencies by moderating desires and focusing on purposeful action.

sanskrit: अप्रकाशोऽप्रवृत्तिश्च प्रमादो मोह एव च। तमस्येतानि जायन्ते विवृद्धे कुरुनन्दन॥
translation: Darkness, inertia, negligence, and delusion arise when tamas is predominant, O descendant of Kuru.
explanation: When confusion and lethargy take over, identify it as tamas. Counteract it with structured routines, physical activity, and seeking inspiration.

sanskrit: यदा सत्त्वे प्रवृद्धे तु प्रलयं याति देहभृत्। तदोतमविदां लोकानमलान्प्रतिपद्यते॥
translation: When one dies in a state of sattva, they attain the pure worlds of those who know the highest.
explanation: Living a virtuous, pure life leads to higher states of existence. Focus on cultivating wisdom, compassion, and selflessness.

sanskrit: रजसि प्रलयं गत्वा कर्मसङ्गिषु जायते। तथा प्रलीनस्तमसि मूढयोनिषु जायते॥
translation: Dying in rajas leads one to be born among those attached to action. Dying in tamas leads to rebirth in the wombs of the deluded.
explanation: Be mindful of your inner state. Attachments and ignorance lead to entanglement. Strive to act with awareness and detachment.

sanskrit: कर्मणः सुकृतस्याहुः सात्त्विकं निर्मलं फलम्। रजसस्तु फलं दुःखमज्ञानं तमसः फलम्॥
translation: The fruit of sattvic action is purity; the fruit of rajasic action is sorrow, and the fruit of tamasic action is ignorance.
explanation: Choose your actions wisely. Acts of purity and selflessness yield long-term happiness, while selfishness or negligence leads to suffering or ignorance.

sanskrit: सत्त्वात्संजायते ज्ञानं रजसो लोभ एव च। प्रमादमोहौ तमसो भवतोऽज्ञानमेव च॥
translation: From sattva arises knowledge, from rajas arises greed, and from tamas arise negligence, delusion, and ignorance.
explanation: Foster positive energies through learning and mindfulness. Avoid getting consumed by greed or delusion, as they lead away from wisdom.

sanskrit: ऊर्ध्वं गच्छन्ति सत्त्वस्था मध्ये तिष्ठन्ति राजसाः। जघन्यगुणवृत्तिस्था अधो गच्छन्ति तामसाः॥
translation: Those established in sattva rise upward; those in rajas remain in the middle, while those dominated by tamas go downward.
explanation: Your inner tendencies shape your life’s trajectory. Strive for higher states by cultivating virtues and reducing ignorance or excessive desire.

sanskrit: नान्यं गुणेभ्यः कर्तारं यदा द्रष्टानुपश्यति। गुणेभ्यश्च परं वेत्ति मद्भावं सोऽधिगच्छति॥
translation: When one sees no doer other than the gunas and knows the Supreme beyond the gunas, they attain My state.
explanation: Understand that qualities (gunas) influence actions. Detach from these tendencies and focus on realizing your higher self.

sanskrit: गुणानेतानतीत्य त्रीन्देही देहसमुद्भवान्। जन्ममृत्युजरादुःखैरविमुक्तोऽमृतमश्नुते॥
translation: Transcending these three gunas, which arise from the body, the embodied being becomes free from birth, death, old age, and sorrow and attains immortality.
explanation: Rise above the influences of nature’s qualities by self-awareness and spiritual discipline. This leads to liberation and eternal peace.

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। कैर्लिङ्गैस्त्रीन्गुणानेतानतीतो भवति प्रभो। किमाचारः कथं चैतांस्त्रीन्गुणानतिवर्तते॥
translation: Arjuna said: By what signs is one known who has transcended these three gunas, O Lord? What is their conduct, and how do they rise above these three gunas?
explanation: When seeking freedom from influences like passion, ignorance, or purity, ask yourself how to transcend limiting qualities. Reflect on your behavior and aim to act without attachment.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। प्रकाशं च प्रवृत्तिं च मोहमेव च पाण्डव। न द्वेष्टि सम्प्रवृत्तानि न निवृत्तानि काङ्क्षति॥
translation: The Blessed Lord said: O Pandava, one who neither hates illumination, activity, and delusion when they arise, nor longs for them when they cease, is said to have transcended the gunas.
explanation: To transcend worldly qualities, cultivate equanimity. Accept circumstances as they come and let go of longing for specific outcomes.

sanskrit: उदासीनवदासीनो गुणैर्यो न विचाल्यते। गुणा वर्तन्त इत्येव योऽवतिष्ठति नेङ्गते॥
translation: One who sits like an indifferent observer, unmoved by the gunas, knowing that the gunas act and do not move the self, transcends the gunas.
explanation: Adopt the mindset of a detached observer. Recognize that external forces (gunas) influence actions but do not define your true self.

sanskrit: समदुःखसुखः स्वस्थः समलोष्टाश्मकाञ्चनः। तुल्यप्रियाप्रियो धीरस्तुल्यनिन्दात्मसंस्तुतिः॥
translation: One who is the same in pleasure and pain, self-contained, and regards a clod of earth, a stone, and gold as equal; who is impartial toward the pleasant and the unpleasant, and who is firm and equal in blame and praise, is said to be transcendent.
explanation: Develop resilience by treating success and failure, praise and criticism, as equal. This steadiness allows freedom from emotional upheavals.

sanskrit: मानापमानयोस्तुल्यो तुल्यो मित्रारिपक्षयोः। सर्वारम्भपरित्यागी गुणातीतः स उच्यते॥
translation: One who is the same in honor and dishonor, the same to friend and foe, and who has renounced all selfish undertakings, is said to have transcended the gunas.
explanation: To rise above external influences, remain unaffected by others' opinions and focus on selfless actions rather than personal gain.

sanskrit: मां च योऽव्यभिचारेण भक्तियोगेन सेवते। स गुणान्समतीत्यैतान्ब्रह्मभूयाय कल्पते॥
translation: One who serves Me with unfailing devotion through the yoga of love transcends these gunas and becomes eligible for Brahman.
explanation: Devotion to a higher purpose or divinity helps transcend material influences. Commit to a practice of love and devotion for spiritual growth.

sanskrit: ब्रह्मणो हि प्रतिष्ठाहममृतस्याव्ययस्य च। शाश्वतस्य च धर्मस्य सुखस्यैकान्तिकस्य च॥
translation: For I am the foundation of the imperishable Brahman, of immortality, of eternal dharma, and of unending divine bliss.
explanation: Understand that the ultimate source of stability and bliss lies in aligning with the eternal principles of dharma. This awareness guides you toward lasting peace.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। ऊर्ध्वमूलमधःशाखमश्वत्थं प्राहुरव्ययम्। छन्दांसि यस्य पर्णानि यस्तं वेद स वेदवित्॥
translation: The Blessed Lord said: They speak of the imperishable banyan tree that has its roots above and branches below, whose leaves are the Vedic hymns; one who knows this tree is the knower of the Vedas.
explanation: Life is like a tree rooted in the spiritual realm, but with branches spread in the material world. Reflect on your spiritual foundation to understand the true purpose of existence.

sanskrit: अधश्चोर्ध्वं प्रसृतास्तस्य शाखा गुणप्रवृद्धा विषयप्रवालाः। अधश्च मूलान्यनुसन्ततानि कर्मानुबन्धीनि मनुष्यलोके॥
translation: The branches of this tree spread both upwards and downwards, nourished by the modes of nature, with sense objects as its buds. Its roots also extend downward, binding souls to action in the human realm.
explanation: Material desires bind us to the cycle of actions. Recognize how sensory indulgence strengthens these attachments, and seek liberation through detachment.

sanskrit: न रूपमस्येह तथोपलभ्यते नान्तो न चादिर्न च सम्प्रतिष्ठा। अश्वत्थमेनं सुविरूढमूलमसङ्गशस्त्रेण दृढेन छित्त्वा॥
translation: Its form is not perceived in this world, nor its end, origin, or foundation. Having cut down this deeply rooted tree with the strong weapon of detachment, one must seek liberation.
explanation: Liberation requires the sword of detachment. Let go of deeply ingrained habits and attachments that obstruct clarity and spiritual growth.

sanskrit: ततः पदं तत्परिमार्गितव्यं यस्मिन्गता न निवर्तन्ति भूयः। तमेव चाद्यं पुरुषं प्रपद्ये यतः प्रवृत्तिः प्रसृता पुराणी॥
translation: Thereafter, one must seek that supreme state, from which there is no return, surrendering to the primal person from whom creation has emanated.
explanation: Focus on the ultimate goal of self-realization. Surrender to the source of all existence to transcend the cycle of rebirth.

sanskrit: निर्मानमोहा जितसङ्गदोषा अध्यात्मनित्या विनिवृत्तकामाः। द्वन्द्वैर्विमुक्ताः सुखदुःखसंज्ञैर्गच्छन्त्यमूढाः पदमव्ययं तत्॥
translation: Free from pride and delusion, conquering attachment, dwelling constantly in the self, renouncing desires, and free from the dualities of pleasure and pain, the undeluded reach that eternal state.
explanation: Let go of ego, illusions, and desires. Freedom from dualities enables one to attain the eternal state of peace and contentment.

sanskrit: न तद्भासयते सूर्यः न शशाङ्को न पावकः। यद्गत्वा न निवर्तन्ते तद्धाम परमं मम॥
translation: That supreme abode of Mine is not illuminated by the sun, moon, or fire. Having reached there, one does not return to this material world.
explanation: The ultimate destination is beyond material illumination. Seek the inner light and eternal refuge within the divine.

sanskrit: ममैवांशो जीवलोके जीवभूतः सनातनः। मनःषष्ठानीन्द्रियाणि प्रकृतिस्थानि कर्षति॥
translation: An eternal fragment of Myself, situated in the material world, draws to itself the mind and the five senses, which rest in nature.
explanation: Recognize your divine essence as an eternal part of the higher self. Guard against the distractions of the senses.

sanskrit: शरीरं यदवाप्नोति यच्चाप्युत्क्रामतीश्वरः। गृहीत्वैतानि संयाति वायुरगन्धानिवाशयात्॥
translation: When the soul acquires a body and when it leaves it, it takes the mind and senses, just as the wind carries fragrances from their source.
explanation: Life transitions are inevitable. The essence of the soul persists, carrying impressions across lifetimes. Focus on purifying these impressions.

sanskrit: श्रोत्रं चक्षुः स्पर्शनं च रसनं घ्राणमेव च। अधिष्ठाय मनश्चायं विषयानुपसेवते॥
translation: Presiding over the ear, eye, touch, taste, and smell, as well as the mind, the soul enjoys the sense objects.
explanation: The senses are tools for interaction, not indulgence. Use them mindfully to align with your higher purpose.

sanskrit: उत्क्रामन्तं स्थितं वापि भुञ्जानं वा गुणान्वितम्। विमूढा नानुपश्यन्ति पश्यन्ति ज्ञानचक्षुषः॥
translation: The deluded do not perceive the soul departing, dwelling in the body, or enjoying through the senses, but those with the eye of wisdom see it.
explanation: Develop wisdom to see beyond physical appearances. Awareness of the soul's journey provides deeper clarity and detachment.

sanskrit: यतन्तो योगिनश्चैनं पश्यन्त्यात्मन्यवस्थितम्। यतन्तोऽप्यकृतात्मानो नैनं पश्यन्त्यचेतसः॥
translation: Striving yogis see the Self dwelling in their hearts, but those whose minds are impure and unrefined cannot perceive it, even though they strive.
explanation: Purify your mind and heart through self-discipline and meditation to perceive the true Self. Efforts without inner refinement fail to bring clarity.

sanskrit: यदादित्यगतं तेजो जगद्भासयतेऽखिलम्। यच्चन्द्रमसि यच्चाग्नौ तत्केजो विद्धि मामकम्॥
translation: Know that the light of the sun, which illuminates the entire world, and the light in the moon and fire, all come from Me.
explanation: Recognize the divine presence in all sources of light and energy. This awareness fosters gratitude and connection to the universe.

sanskrit: गामाविश्य च भूतानि धारयाम्यहमोजसा। पुष्णामि चौषधीः सर्वाः सोमो भूत्वा रसात्मकः॥
translation: Entering the earth, I support all living beings with My energy. Becoming the moon, I nourish all plants with My essence.
explanation: Appreciate the interconnectedness of nature and divine sustenance. Gratitude for natural resources nurtures a sense of responsibility to protect them.

sanskrit: अहं वैश्वानरो भूत्वा प्राणिनां देहमाश्रितः। प्राणापानसमायुक्तः पचाम्यन्नं चतुर्विधम्॥
translation: Becoming the digestive fire in the bodies of all living beings, I digest the four kinds of food by combining with the life breaths.
explanation: The divine sustains us even in basic functions like digestion. Mindful eating and appreciation of food align us with this divine energy.

sanskrit: सर्वस्य चाहं हृदि सन्निविष्टो। मत्तः स्मृतिज्ञानमपोहनं च। वेदैश्च सर्वैरहमेव वेद्यो। वेदान्तकृद्वेदविदेव चाहम्॥
translation: I am seated in the hearts of all. From Me come memory, knowledge, and forgetfulness. I am to be known by all the Vedas; indeed, I am the compiler of Vedanta and the knower of the Vedas.
explanation: Look within to connect with the source of all wisdom and memory. True knowledge transcends external learning and arises from inner connection.

sanskrit: द्वाविमौ पुरुषौ लोके क्षरश्चाक्षर एव च। क्षरः सर्वाणि भूतानि कूटस्थोऽक्षर उच्यते॥
translation: There are two types of beings in this world: the perishable and the imperishable. All living entities are perishable, while the soul is imperishable.
explanation: Understand the distinction between the material and the eternal. Focusing on the imperishable soul brings clarity and reduces attachment to the temporary.

sanskrit: उत्तमः पुरुषस्त्वन्यः परमात्मेत्युदाहृतः। यो लोकत्रयमाविश्य बिभर्त्यव्यय ईश्वरः॥
translation: But beyond the perishable and imperishable is the Supreme Person, the eternal Lord, who sustains the three worlds.
explanation: The Supreme sustains all existence. Surrender to this eternal reality to transcend worldly limitations and align with divine will.

sanskrit: यस्मात्क्षरमतीतोऽहमक्षरादपि चोत्तमः। अतोऽस्मि लोके वेदे च प्रथितः पुरुषोत्तमः॥
translation: Since I transcend both the perishable and imperishable, I am celebrated in the world and in the Vedas as the Supreme Person.
explanation: Recognize the Supreme as the ultimate reality. Aligning with this understanding elevates one's purpose and actions.

sanskrit: यो मामेवमसंमूढो जानाति पुरुषोत्तमम्। स सर्वविद्भजति मां सर्वभावेन भारत॥
translation: One who knows Me as the Supreme Person without doubt is the knower of everything and worships Me with all their being, O Arjuna.
explanation: Clarity in understanding the Supreme brings true wisdom. Cultivate devotion and alignment with the divine for holistic knowledge.

sanskrit: इति गुह्यतमं शास्त्रमिदमुक्तं मयानघ। एतद्बुद्ध्वा बुद्धिमान्स्यात्कृतकृत्यश्च भारत॥
translation: Thus, this most confidential knowledge has been imparted by Me. Understanding this, one becomes wise and fulfills all purposes of life.
explanation: True wisdom lies in understanding the essence of existence. Reflect on this sacred knowledge to achieve fulfillment and clarity of purpose.

sanskrit: अभयं सत्त्वसंशुद्धिर्ज्ञानयोगव्यवस्थिति:। दानं दमश्च यज्ञश्च स्वाध्यायस्तप आर्जवम्॥
translation: Fearlessness, purity of mind, steadfastness in knowledge and yoga, charity, self-restraint, sacrifice, study of scriptures, austerity, and straightforwardness.
explanation: Cultivate these qualities to build a strong foundation for personal growth and spiritual progress. They reduce fear and foster inner clarity.

sanskrit: अहिंसा सत्यं अक्रोधस्त्यागः शान्तिरपैशुनम्। दया भूतेष्वलोलुप्त्वं मार्दवं ह्रीरचापलम्॥
translation: Non-violence, truthfulness, absence of anger, renunciation, tranquility, non-slander, compassion, lack of greed, gentleness, modesty, and absence of fickleness.
explanation: Practice these virtues to lead a harmonious and ethical life. They help in resolving conflicts and establishing trust with others.

sanskrit: तेजः क्षमा धृतिः शौचमद्रोहो नातिमानिता। भवन्ति सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातस्य भारत॥
translation: Vigor, forgiveness, fortitude, cleanliness, absence of malice, and lack of arrogance belong to one born with divine qualities.
explanation: Adopt divine qualities to overcome challenges with strength and humility. These traits bring respect and peace in relationships.

sanskrit: दम्भो दर्पोऽभिमानश्च क्रोधः पारुष्यमेव च। अज्ञानं चाभिजातस्य पार्थ सम्पदामासुरीम्॥
translation: Hypocrisy, arrogance, conceit, anger, harshness, and ignorance are the traits of those born with demonic qualities.
explanation: Recognize and avoid these traits to prevent self-destructive tendencies. Practicing humility and patience leads to better decision-making.

sanskrit: दैवी सम्पद्विमोक्षाय निबन्धायासुरी मता। मा शुचः सम्पदं दैवीमभिजातोऽसि पाण्डव॥
translation: The divine qualities lead to liberation, while the demonic qualities bind one to material existence. Do not grieve, O Arjuna, for you are born with divine qualities.
explanation: Focus on cultivating virtues for liberation from stress and attachments. Recognize your potential to embody divine qualities.

sanskrit: द्वौ भूतसर्गौ लोकेऽस्मिन्दैव आसुर एव च। दैवो विस्तरशः प्रोक्त आसुरं पार्थ मे शृणु॥
translation: There are two types of beings in this world: the divine and the demonic. The divine has been described at length; now hear about the demonic, O Arjuna.
explanation: Understand the dual nature of qualities to discern what leads to growth or downfall. This awareness guides balanced choices.

sanskrit: प्रवृत्तिं च निवृत्तिं च जनाना विदुरासुराः। न शौचं नापि चाचारो न सत्यं तेषु विद्यते॥
translation: Demonic people do not know what is to be done and what is not to be done. They lack cleanliness, proper conduct, and truthfulness.
explanation: Reflect on actions and align with ethical principles to avoid chaos and negativity. Proper conduct leads to societal harmony.

sanskrit: असत्यमप्रतिष्ठं ते जगदाहुरनीश्वरम्। अपरस्परसम्भूतं किमन्यत्कामहैतुकम्॥
translation: They say the world is without truth, without a foundation, without a God, and born of desire and nothing else.
explanation: Recognize the dangers of nihilistic views. Cultivate faith in higher principles to bring purpose and meaning to life.

sanskrit: एतां दृष्टिमवष्टभ्य नष्टात्मानोऽल्पबुद्धयः। प्रभवन्त्युग्रकर्माणः क्षयाय जगतोऽहिताः॥
translation: Holding such a view, these lost souls with little intelligence engage in cruel actions aimed at the destruction of the world.
explanation: Beware of destructive tendencies arising from ignorance. Focus on constructive actions that benefit both self and society.

sanskrit: काममाश्रित्य दुष्पूरं दम्भमानमदान्विताः। मोहाद्गृहित्वासद्ग्राहान्प्रवर्तन्तेऽशुचिव्रताः॥
translation: Driven by insatiable desires, pride, and arrogance, and blinded by delusion, they engage in impure activities, holding false beliefs.
explanation: Identify and limit excessive desires to avoid being consumed by them. Pursue clarity and meaningful values to find peace.

sanskrit: चिन्तामपरिमेयां च प्रलयान्तामुपाश्रिताः। कामोपभोगपरमा एतावदिति निश्चिताः॥
translation: Obsessed with endless worries and desires lasting until death, they remain engrossed in sense pleasures, convinced it is everything.
explanation: Shift focus from temporary pleasures to lasting fulfillment. Letting go of overthinking reduces stress and enhances clarity.

sanskrit: आशापाशशतैर्बद्धाः कामक्रोधपरायणाः। ईहन्ते कामभोगार्थमन्यायेनार्थसञ्चयान्॥
translation: Bound by hundreds of desires, driven by lust and anger, they accumulate wealth through unjust means for sense gratification.
explanation: Avoid unethical practices driven by greed. Focus on ethical efforts for material success, ensuring peace and self-respect.

sanskrit: इदमद्य मया लब्धमिमं प्राप्स्ये मनोरथम्। इदमस्तीदमपि मे भविष्यति पुनर्धनम्॥
translation: This has been gained by me today, and I shall achieve this desire. This wealth is mine, and more will be mine in the future.
explanation: Overattachment to material gains and desires leads to greed and discontentment. Focus on gratitude and use resources responsibly to achieve lasting happiness.

sanskrit: असौ मया हतः शत्रुर्हनिष्ये चापरानपि। ईश्वरोऽहमहं भोगी सिद्धोऽहं बलवान्सुखी॥
translation: That enemy has been slain by me, and others too shall I kill. I am the lord, I am the enjoyer, I am perfect, powerful, and happy.
explanation: Arrogance blinds one to reality and causes harm. Practice humility and acknowledge the role of others and higher forces in success to maintain harmony.

sanskrit: आढ्योऽभिजनवानस्मि कोऽन्योऽस्ति सदृशो मया। यक्ष्ये दास्यामि मोदिष्य इत्यज्ञानविमोहिताः॥
translation: I am wealthy and born in a noble family. Who else is equal to me? I shall perform sacrifices, give charity, and rejoice. Thus, they are deluded by ignorance.
explanation: Overestimating oneself leads to delusion. Recognize the interconnectedness of life and adopt a mindset of service rather than self-glorification.

sanskrit: अनेकचित्तविभ्रान्ता मोहजालसमावृताः। प्रसक्ता कामभोगेषु पतन्ति नरकेऽशुचौ॥
translation: Bewildered by numerous thoughts, entangled in the web of delusion, and attached to sense pleasures, they fall into a foul hell.
explanation: Uncontrolled desires and distractions lead to downfall. Simplify life and prioritize meaningful goals for mental clarity and peace.

sanskrit: आत्मसंभाविताः स्तब्धा धनमानमदान्विताः। यजन्ते नामयज्ञैस्ते दम्भेनाविधिपूर्वकम्॥
translation: Self-conceited, stubborn, filled with pride and arrogance of wealth, they perform sacrifices in name only, with hypocrisy, not following the proper rules.
explanation: Hypocrisy in actions undermines authenticity. Align external actions with inner values to build integrity and trust.

sanskrit: अहंकारं बलं दर्पं कामं क्रोधं च संयुताः। मामात्मपरदेहेषु प्रद्विषन्तोऽभ्यसूयकाः॥
translation: Filled with ego, strength, arrogance, desire, and anger, they envy Me in their own and others' bodies and blaspheme against Me.
explanation: Negative emotions like anger and envy distort perception and relationships. Cultivate patience and respect for others' individuality to foster harmony.

sanskrit: तानहं द्विषतः क्रुरान्संसारेषु नराधमान्। क्षिपाम्यजस्रमशुभानासुरीष्वेव योनिषु॥
translation: These cruel haters, the worst among men, I repeatedly throw into demonic wombs in the cycle of birth and death.
explanation: Negative actions perpetuate suffering. Break this cycle by embracing virtues like compassion and self-discipline.

sanskrit: आसुरीं योनिमापन्ना मूढा जन्मनि जन्मनि। मामप्राप्यैव कौन्तेय ततो यान्त्यधमां गतिम्॥
translation: Falling into demonic wombs, these deluded ones, life after life, fail to attain Me, O Arjuna, and sink lower and lower.
explanation: Ignoring spiritual growth leads to repeated failures. Focus on self-awareness and higher values to elevate your life.

sanskrit: त्रिविधं नरकस्येदं द्वारं नाशनमात्मनः। कामः क्रोधस्तथा लोभस्तस्मादेतत्त्रयं त्यजेत्॥
translation: Lust, anger, and greed—these three are the gateways to hell, destructive to the self. Therefore, one must abandon them.
explanation: Eliminate these three traits to avoid self-destruction and lead a balanced, fulfilling life.

sanskrit: एतैर्विमुक्तः कौन्तेय तमोद्वारैस्त्रिभिर्नरः। आचरत्यात्मनः श्रेयस्ततो याति परां गतिम्॥
translation: Freed from these three gates of darkness, a person works for his own elevation and thus attains the supreme destination.
explanation: Freedom from vices allows one to focus on self-improvement and achieve higher goals. Practice self-control for spiritual upliftment.

sanskrit: यः शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य वर्तते कामकारतः। न स सिद्धिमवाप्नोति न सुखं न परां गतिम्॥
translation: He who discards scriptural injunctions and acts according to his own desires neither attains success, happiness, nor the supreme goal.
explanation: Ignoring guidance leads to failure. Respect proven principles and seek wisdom to achieve success and contentment.

sanskrit: तस्माच्छास्त्रं प्रमाणं ते कार्याकार्यव्यवस्थितौ। ज्ञात्वा शास्त्रविधानोक्तं कर्म कर्तुमिहार्हसि॥
translation: Therefore, let scripture be your authority in determining what is to be done and what is not to be done. Knowing the rules prescribed in the scriptures, you should act accordingly.
explanation: Use scripture and moral principles as a guide to distinguish right from wrong. This ensures wise decisions and righteous actions.

sanskrit: अर्जुन उवाच। ये शास्त्रविधिमुत्सृज्य यजन्ते श्रद्धयान्विताः। तेषां निष्ठा तु का कृष्ण सत्त्वमाहो रजस्तमः॥
translation: Arjuna said: Those who disregard scriptural injunctions yet worship with faith, what is their condition, O Krishna? Is it sattva, rajas, or tamas?
explanation: Faith varies based on one's nature. Seek knowledge and align actions with wisdom to ensure that faith leads to growth rather than confusion.

sanskrit: श्रीभगवानुवाच। त्रिविधा भवति श्रद्धा देहिनां सा स्वभावजा। सात्त्विकी राजसी चैव तामसी चेति तां शृणु॥
translation: The Blessed Lord said: Faith is of three kinds, born of one's nature—sattvic, rajasic, and tamasic. Listen as I explain this.
explanation: Understand that faith stems from inner tendencies. Reflect on your beliefs and refine them for spiritual and personal advancement.

sanskrit: सत्त्वानुरूपा सर्वस्य श्रद्धा भवति भारत। श्रद्धामयोऽयं पुरुषो यो यच्छ्रद्धः स एव सः॥
translation: The faith of each individual corresponds to their nature, O Bharata. A person is defined by the faith they possess.
explanation: Your faith shapes your identity. Cultivate positive beliefs that align with your values and desired growth.

sanskrit: यजन्ते सात्त्विका देवान्यक्षरक्षांसि राजसाः। प्रेतान्भूतगणांश्चान्ये यजन्ते तामसा जनाः॥
translation: Sattvic people worship gods, rajasic people worship spirits and demigods, and tamasic people worship ghosts and lower beings.
explanation: Your focus reflects your nature. Direct your energy toward uplifting pursuits to achieve clarity and higher goals.

sanskrit: अशास्त्रविहितं घोरं तप्यन्ते ये तपो जनाः। दम्भाहंकारसंयुक्ताः कामरागबलान्विताः॥
translation: Those who practice severe austerities not prescribed by scripture, driven by hypocrisy and ego, and motivated by desire and attachment.
explanation: Misguided efforts waste energy. Align actions with ethical principles and authentic intent to yield positive results.

sanskrit: कर्शयन्तः शरीरस्थं भूतग्राममचेतसः। मां चैवान्तःशरीरस्थं तान्विद्ध्यासुरनिश्चयान्॥
translation: Tormenting the elements within the body and Me who dwells within, such deluded ones are of demonic resolve.
explanation: Self-harm and disregard for inner divinity lead to negativity. Respect your body and inner self to cultivate harmony.

sanskrit: आहारस्त्वपि सर्वस्य त्रिविधो भवति प्रियः। यज्ञस्तपस्तथा दानं तेषां भेदमिमं शृणु॥
translation: Food, sacrifice, austerity, and charity are of three kinds. Hear about these distinctions.
explanation: Every action, including food and rituals, influences your nature. Choose wisely to support your well-being and growth.

sanskrit: आयुःसत्त्वबलारोग्यसुखप्रीतिविवर्धनाः। रस्यान्स्निग्धाः स्थिरा हृद्या आहाराः सात्त्विकप्रियाः॥
translation: Foods that promote life, purity, strength, health, joy, and satisfaction, which are wholesome, substantial, and agreeable, are dear to the sattvic.
explanation: Healthy, balanced choices enhance well-being. Opt for foods and habits that nurture both body and mind.

sanskrit: कट्वम्ललवणात्यु्ष्णतीक्ष्णरूक्षविदाहिनः। आहाराः राजसस्येष्टा दुःखशोकामयप्रदाः॥
translation: Foods that are too bitter, sour, salty, hot, pungent, dry, and burning are preferred by the rajasic and cause pain, grief, and disease.
explanation: Overindulgence in extremes creates imbalance. Moderation and mindfulness in consumption prevent physical and emotional distress.

sanskrit: यातयामं गतरसं पूति पर्युषितं च यत्। उच्छिष्टमपि चामेध्यं भोजनं तामसप्रियम्॥
translation: Food that is stale, tasteless, foul, decomposed, leftover, and impure is liked by the tamasic.
explanation: Neglecting quality in diet reflects and reinforces lethargy and negativity. Prioritize fresh and wholesome choices to uplift energy.

sanskrit: अफलाङ्क्षिभिर्यज्ञो विधिदृष्टो य इज्यते। यष्टव्यमेवेति मनः समाधाय स सात्त्विकः॥
translation: The sacrifice performed according to scriptural injunctions, without desire for rewards, and with a focused mind is sattvic.
explanation: Perform actions without attachment to results. Align efforts with principles to maintain purity of intent and steady focus.

sanskrit: अभिसन्धाय तु फलं दम्भार्थमपि चैव यत्। इज्यते भरतश्रेष्ठ तं यज्ञं विद्धि राजसम्॥
translation: The sacrifice performed with the aim of gaining rewards or for show is rajasic, O best of the Bharatas.
explanation: Actions driven by ego or material desires lead to instability. Focus on intrinsic value rather than external recognition.

sanskrit: विधिहीनमसृष्टान्नं मन्त्रहीनमदक्षिणम्। श्रद्धाविरहितं यज्ञं तामसं परिचक्षते॥
translation: A sacrifice performed without following scriptural rules, without food offerings, devoid of mantras, charity, and faith, is tamasic.
explanation: Neglecting essential elements leads to ineffective outcomes. Be mindful of details and invest sincere faith in efforts.

sanskrit: देवद्विजगुरुप्राज्ञपूजनं शौचमार्जवम्। ब्रह्मचर्यमहिंसा च शारीरं तप उच्यते॥
translation: Worship of the divine, teachers, wise ones, purity, straightforwardness, celibacy, and non-violence is considered bodily austerity.
explanation: Respect for others and self-discipline build strong foundations. Cultivate these qualities to strengthen character.

sanskrit: अनुद्वेगकरं वाक्यं सत्यं प्रियहितं च यत्। स्वाध्यायाभ्यसनं चैव वाङ्मयं तप उच्यते॥
translation: Speech that does not agitate others, is truthful, pleasant, and beneficial, along with regular recitation of scriptures, is verbal austerity.
explanation: Choose words that heal and uplift. Regularly reflect on wisdom to maintain clarity and positivity in communication.

sanskrit: मनःप्रसादः सौम्यत्वं मौनमात्मविनिग्रहः। भावसंशुद्धिरित्येतत्तपो मानसमुच्यते॥
translation: Serenity of mind, gentleness, silence, self-restraint, and purity of thought—these are mental austerities.
explanation: Inner peace and control over thoughts are key to mental strength. Practice mindfulness and positive thinking.

sanskrit: श्रद्धया परया तप्तं तपस्तत्त्रिविधं नरैः। अफलाकाङ्क्षिभिर्युक्तैः सात्त्विकं परिचक्षते॥
translation: The threefold austerity practiced with supreme faith, by those unattached to rewards, is considered sattvic.
explanation: Faithful, selfless efforts bring inner strength. Let go of expectations to achieve true growth.

sanskrit: सत्कारमानपूजार्थं तपो दम्भेन चैव यत्। क्रियते तदिह प्रोक्तं राजसं चलमध्रुवम्॥
translation: Austerity performed for respect, honor, or worship, and with hypocrisy, is rajasic and unstable.
explanation: Efforts motivated by external validation are fleeting. Focus on authentic and enduring values.

sanskrit: मूढग्राहेणात्मनो यत्पीडया क्रियते तपः। परस्योत्सादनार्थं वा तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्॥
translation: Austerity performed with foolish obstinacy, self-torture, or to harm others is tamasic.
explanation: Avoid actions that harm yourself or others. Choose paths that foster well-being and harmony.

sanskrit: दातव्यमिति यद्दानं दीयतेऽनुपकारिणे। देशे काले च पात्रे च तद्दानं सात्त्विकं स्मृतम्॥
translation: Charity given at the right place, time, and to a worthy person, without expectation of return, is considered sattvic.
explanation: True giving arises from generosity, not expectation. Share resources wisely to make a meaningful impact.

sanskrit: यत्तु प्रत्युपकारार्थं फलमुद्दिश्य वा पुनः। दीयते च परikliष्टं तद्दानं राजसं स्मृतम्॥
translation: Charity given with the expectation of something in return or for a specific reward, and given reluctantly, is considered rajasic.
explanation: Giving should stem from generosity, not expectations. Replace conditional giving with sincere kindness to build lasting relationships.

sanskrit: अदेशकाले यद्दानमपात्रेभ्यश्च दीयते। असत्कृतमवज्ञातं तत्तामसमुदाहृतम्॥
translation: Charity given at the wrong time, in the wrong place, to unworthy recipients, or disrespectfully, is tamasic.
explanation: Thoughtless giving can lead to harm. Practice mindful charity by considering the recipient, context, and intention.

sanskrit: ॐ तत्सदिति निर्देशो ब्रह्मणस्त्रिविधः स्मृतः। ब्राह्मणास्तेन वेदाश्च यज्ञाश्च विहिताः पुरा॥
translation: The words 'Om Tat Sat' are said to represent the Supreme Absolute Truth. Through these, the Brahmanas, the Vedas, and sacrifices were ordained in ancient times.
explanation: Use sacred principles to guide actions. Anchoring in universal truths fosters spiritual alignment and clarity.

sanskrit: तस्मादोमित्युदाहृत्य यज्ञदानतपःक्रियाः। प्रवर्तन्ते विधानोक्ता सततं ब्रह्मवादिनाम्॥
translation: Therefore, sacrifices, charity, and austerities prescribed in the scriptures are always performed by those who believe in the Absolute with the utterance of 'Om.'
explanation: Begin actions with mindfulness and spiritual awareness. This ensures harmony with universal laws and principles.

sanskrit: तदित्यनभिसंधाय फलं यज्ञतपःक्रियाः। दानक्रियाश्च विविधाः क्रियन्ते मोक्षकाङ्क्षिभिः॥
translation: With the utterance of 'Tat,' acts of sacrifice, austerity, and charity are performed without seeking rewards by those desiring liberation.
